column3: but fails to find anything if the '/' character is anywhereelse in the string.Reproducible: AlwaysSteps to Reproduce:1. go tohttp://bonsai.mozilla.org/cvsquery.cgi?treeid=default&module=PhoenixTinderbox&branch=FIREBIRD_0_8_BRANCH&branchtype=match&dir=&file=&filetype=match&who=&whotype=match&sortby=Date&hours=2&date=explicit&mindate=12%2F31%2F2003&maxdate=1%2F1%2F2004&cvsroot=%2Fcvsroot2. Click on Edit->Find in This Page 3. Enter browser/app as the text to search for4. Click on Find NextActual Actual results:  Recieved pop-up saying "The text you entered was not found"Expected Actual results:  Should have found the text as it is present on the page § 2004-01-07T14:21:40Z § 2004-01-07T15:53:58Z

column1: 320031 § INCOMPLETE § major § defect § RESOLVED § Client Software § 7 § -- § None§ 0§ 0§None§ 0§ 0§1. See "Details"2.3.§23§3§None§ 0§ 0§FF should allow popups from all sites that have been configured as such
column2: as long as the browesr is operating.This condition happens in all releases of FF since 1.0.0. This condition has never been observed in any release of Mozilla.§234§2§: Always§9§1§:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.8) Gecko/20051111 Firefox/1.5Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.8) Gecko/20051111 Firefox/1.5We have an internal application that uses popup screens for a variety of functions. In order for our application to work properly
column3: we have to configure FF to allow popups from the application's site
column4: which at first
column5: seems to work fine. The popus appear as expected.I have noticed that
column6: after extended periods of use (several hours and the appearance of maybe 100 or more popup screens)
column7: I eventually encounter the message that "Firefox has prevented this site from opening a popup". If you click the "Options" button
column8: the options available seem to indicate that poups are already allowed fromn this site (which they are). If you look at the list of sites from which popups are allowed
column9: the application site is still listed. However
column10: no popups are allowed from that site anymore. The browser will continue to operate in this manner (blocking all popups) until FF is closed and restarted
column11: at which time the cycle begins again.This condition has been observed on all released versions of FF since 1.0.0
column12: and still occurs on 1.5.This condition does not occur on the current release of Mozilla (1.7.11) nor has it been noticed on any of the previous releases. For this reason
column13: I have been primarily been using the Mozilla browser instead of FF when accessing our application.§1466§6§§0§0 § User Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.8) Gecko/20051111 Firefox/1.5Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.8) Gecko/20051111 Firefox/1.5We have an internal application that uses popup screens for a variety of functions. In order for our application to work properly
column14: we have to configure FF to allow popups from the application's site
column15: which at first
column16: seems to work fine. The popus appear as expected.I have noticed that
column17: after extended periods of use (several hours and the appearance of maybe 100 or more popup screens)
column18: I eventually encounter the message that "Firefox has prevented this site from opening a popup". If you click the "Options" button
column19: the options available seem to indicate that poups are already allowed fromn this site (which they are). If you look at the list of sites from which popups are allowed
column20: the application site is still listed. However
column21: no popups are allowed from that site anymore. The browser will continue to operate in this manner (blocking all popups) until FF is closed and restarted
column22: at which time the cycle begins again.This condition has been observed on all released versions of FF since 1.0.0
column23: and still occurs on 1.5.This condition does not occur on the current release of Mozilla (1.7.11) nor has it been noticed on any of the previous releases. For this reason
column24: I have been primarily been using the Mozilla browser instead of FF when accessing our application.Reproducible: AlwaysSteps to Reproduce:1. See "Details"2.3.Actual Actual results:  FF eventually starts blocking popups from sites that have been configured to allow popups. FF continues to block popups until browser is shutdown and restarted. Expected Actual results:  FF should allow popups from all sites that have been configured as such
column25: as long as the browesr is operating.This condition happens in all releases of FF since 1.0.0. This condition has never been observed in any release of Mozilla. § 2005-12-12T22:08:26Z § 2009-09-14T14:35:08Z

column1: 1636523 § FIXED § -- § defect § RESOLVED § Client Software § 2 § P1 § None§ 0§ 0§None§ 0§ 0§None§ 0§ 0§None§ 0§ 0§None§ 0§ 0§None§ 0§ 0§None§ 0§ 0§I had that 'No database found' error [in CI](https://circleci.com/gh/mozilla/glean/60439?utm_campaign=workflow-failed&utm_medium=email&utm_source=notification) and :mdboom suggested we should maybe have `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` set so that we have a better chance of making things like these actionable.§298§1 § I had that 'No database found' error [in CI](https://circleci.com/gh/mozilla/glean/60439?utm_campaign=workflow-failed&utm_medium=email&utm_source=notification) and :mdboom suggested we should maybe have `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` set so that we have a better chance of making things like these actionable. § 2020-05-08T16:39:18Z § 2020-05-11T14:52:43Z

column1: 1635754 § FIXED § -- § defect § RESOLVED § Client Software § 4 § P1 § None§ 0§ 0§None§ 0§ 0§None§ 0§ 0§None§ 0§ 0§None§ 0§ 0§None§ 0§ 0§None§ 0§ 0§While testing out the Fx-iOS integration
column2: I made the mistake of using an underscore when trying to send the legacy telemetry id in the deletion request ping.  Glean parser happily generated the following:```extension GleanMetrics {    enum LegacyIds {        /// The client id from legacy telemetry.        static let clientId = UuidMetricType(            category: "legacy.ids"
column3: name: "client_id"
column4: sendInPings: ["deletion_request"]
column5: lifetime: .user
column6: disabled: false        )    }}```I wondered why the id wasn't getting into the ping until I realized it should be `deletion-request` and not `deletion_request`.  Glean parser should probably error on underscores in this case.§736§16 § While testing out the Fx-iOS integration
column7: I made the mistake of using an underscore when trying to send the legacy telemetry id in the deletion request ping.  Glean parser happily generated the following:```extension GleanMetrics {    enum LegacyIds {        /// The client id from legacy telemetry.        static let clientId = UuidMetricType(            category: "legacy.ids"
column8: name: "client_id"
column9: sendInPings: ["deletion_request"]
column10: lifetime: .user
column11: disabled: false        )    }}```I wondered why the id wasn't getting into the ping until I realized it should be `deletion-request` and not `deletion_request`.  Glean parser should probably error on underscores in this case. § 2020-05-06T13:07:49Z § 2020-05-12T13:19:33Z

column2: the text disregards the end of the div and carries on across the page

column5: expanding the page horizontaly.Reproducible: AlwaysSteps to Reproduce:1. Make a script to change the innerHTML of a div so that the contents is longer than the div itself2.Run itActual Actual results:  the text disregards the end of the div and carries on across the page

Open the browser with the profile from prerequisites.2. Open a new tab and click the "Set Firefox as Default" button from the snippet displayed under the in-content search bar.3. Open a new tab and observe the displayed sections .§236§3§- The following sections are displayed:	- "In-content Search Bar"	- "Top Sites"	- "Recommended by Pocket" (if available)	- "Highlights"	§142§6§- The "Set Firefox to Default" snippet is still displayed under the in-content "Search Bar".**[Notes]:**- The impression ping is also displayed in the "Browser Console" when the snippet is displayed for the second time.- This might be a preloading issue considering the fact that the snippet is displayed only on the first opened tab and the "Set Firefox to Default" snippets are blocked in the "about:newtab#devtools" page right after the "Set Firefox as Default" button is clicked.§487§4§- This issue is also reproducible is the snippet is removed from the "Dismiss" button.- Attached a screen recording of the issue.§131§2§None§ 0§ 0§**[Notes]:**- This issue seems to be intermittent since I have managed to reproduce it only on 3 Firefox profiles from a total of 5.**[Affected versions]:**- Firefox Release 72.0 - Build ID: 20200103162918 - Firefox Release 73.0.1 - Build ID: 20200217142647 - Firefox Release 74.0 - Build ID: 20200309095159 - Firefox Release 75.0 - Build ID: 20200403170909 - Firefox Release 76.0 - Build ID: 20200429185419- Firefox Release 77.0.1 - Build ID: 20200602222727§467§9 § **[Notes]:**- This issue seems to be intermittent since I have managed to reproduce it only on 3 Firefox profiles from a total of 5.**[Affected versions]:**- Firefox Release 72.0 - Build ID: 20200103162918 - Firefox Release 73.0.1 - Build ID: 20200217142647 - Firefox Release 74.0 - Build ID: 20200309095159 - Firefox Release 75.0 - Build ID: 20200403170909 - Firefox Release 76.0 - Build ID: 20200429185419- Firefox Release 77.0.1 - Build ID: 20200602222727**[Affected Platforms]:**- Windows 10 x64- macOS 10.15- Ubuntu 18.04 x64**[Preconditions]:**- Have a Firefox en-US locale build installed.- Have a Firefox profile older than 17 weeks. In order to do that you can change the creation date from the "times.json" file that can be found in the current profile folder.- Have the following pref in the "about:config" page:	- "browser.newtabpage.activity-stream.asrouter.providers.snippets" pref value set to "{"id":"snippets"
column2: enabled:true
column3: type:"remote"
column4: url:"https://snippets.cdn.mozilla.net/%STARTPAGE_VERSION%/%NAME%/%VERSION%/%APPBUILDID%/%BUILD_TARGET%/%LOCALE%/%CHANNEL%/%OS_VERSION%/experiment-202007-hvmt/%DISteps to reproduceIBUTION_VERSION%/"
column5: updateCycleInMs:14400000}".	- "browser.search.region" pref value must not be set to "US".**[Steps to reproduce]:**1. Open the browser with the profile from prerequisites.2. Open a new tab and click the "Set Firefox as Default" button from the snippet displayed under the in-content search bar.3. Open a new tab and observe the displayed sections .**[Expected result]:**- The following sections are displayed:	- "In-content Search Bar"	- "Top Sites"	- "Recommended by Pocket" (if available)	- "Highlights"	**[Actual result]:**- The "Set Firefox to Default" snippet is still displayed under the in-content "Search Bar".**[Notes]:**- The impression ping is also displayed in the "Browser Console" when the snippet is displayed for the second time.- This might be a preloading issue considering the fact that the snippet is displayed only on the first opened tab and the "Set Firefox to Default" snippets are blocked in the "about:newtab#devtools" page right after the "Set Firefox as Default" button is clicked.- This issue is also reproducible is the snippet is removed from the "Dismiss" button.- Attached a screen recording of the issue. § 2020-06-11T12:13:15Z § 2021-02-12T21:12:36Z

Create an empty html document and use the information below to create a sample page:<html><head><title>test</title></head><body><iframe id="testF" src="http://www.mozilla.org" width="100%" height="300"></iframe><script type="text/javascript">function test() {var page =  document.getElementById("testF");//working:alert(page.nodeName);//working:alert(page.contentDocument);//broken; even though it shows up in the DOM inspector!//everything past page.contentDocument is broken!//it does not matter what you use; here 'title' is shown as an examplealert(page.contentDocument.title);}//delayed function to give the iframe a chance to loadsetTimeout("test()"
column2: 2000);</script></body></html>2. Load the page into the browser.3. You will see the error if you open the Javascript Console. (Wait for the javascript alerts to be displayed.4. From the Firefox menu
column3: go to "Tools" >> "DOM Inspector"5. In the DOM Inspector
column4: switch to "Javascript Object" (small icon to the right of "Document - DOM Nodes;" "Document - DOM Nodes" should say "Document - Javascript Object" now.6. Expand "target". Now look for "body" and expand. Underneath "body
column5: look for childNodes" and expand. Expand "1" under "childNodes;" this paticular childNode will have a value of "[object HTMLIFrameElement]". Expand "contentDocument" inside such childNode to find that "title" shows up with no problems. Javascript will break for any property past the "contentDocument"
column6: no matter which one you use
column7: using the DOM Inspector as a reference.§1538§29§None§ 0§ 0§The software should have acted as expected per the DOM Inspector and have displayed the resquested property.This error is mentioned many times if you search in a mayor search engine for "Error: uncaught exception: Permission denied to get property HTMLDocument"However I could not find another complete example that could be duplicated easily.Other similar DOM areas in javascript many cause the javascript parser to break too.§431§4§: Always§9§1§:       Mozilla/5.0 (X11; U; Linux i686; en-US; rv:1.7.12) Gecko/20050920 Firefox/1.0.7Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; U; Linux i686; en-US; rv:1.7.12) Gecko/20050920 Firefox/1.0.7When trying to access any property or anything else under the HTMLDocument (contentDocument) in an iframe with javascript

column9: javascript breaks with:Error: uncaught exception: Permission denied to get property HTMLDocument.title(using 'title' as an example). However the same property is crearly shown in the DOM Inspector under "Tools" >> "DOM Inspector" from the menu. Below detailed information to easily reproduce the bug.Reproducible: AlwaysSteps to Reproduce:1. Create an empty html document and use the information below to create a sample page:<html><head><title>test</title></head><body><iframe id="testF" src="http://www.mozilla.org" width="100%" height="300"></iframe><script type="text/javascript">function test() {var page =  document.getElementById("testF");//working:alert(page.nodeName);//working:alert(page.contentDocument);//broken; even though it shows up in the DOM inspector!//everything past page.contentDocument is broken!//it does not matter what you use; here 'title' is shown as an examplealert(page.contentDocument.title);}//delayed function to give the iframe a chance to loadsetTimeout("test()"
column10: 2000);</script></body></html>2. Load the page into the browser.3. You will see the error if you open the Javascript Console. (Wait for the javascript alerts to be displayed.4. From the Firefox menu
column11: go to "Tools" >> "DOM Inspector"5. In the DOM Inspector
column12: switch to "Javascript Object" (small icon to the right of "Document - DOM Nodes;" "Document - DOM Nodes" should say "Document - Javascript Object" now.6. Expand "target". Now look for "body" and expand. Underneath "body
column13: look for childNodes" and expand. Expand "1" under "childNodes;" this paticular childNode will have a value of "[object HTMLIFrameElement]". Expand "contentDocument" inside such childNode to find that "title" shows up with no problems. Javascript will break for any property past the "contentDocument"
column14: no matter which one you use
column15: using the DOM Inspector as a reference.Actual Actual results:  You will see the error:Error: uncaught exception: Permission denied to get property HTMLDocument.titlein the Javascript Console. And javascript breaks.Expected Actual results:  The software should have acted as expected per the DOM Inspector and have displayed the resquested property.This error is mentioned many times if you search in a mayor search engine for "Error: uncaught exception: Permission denied to get property HTMLDocument"However I could not find another complete example that could be duplicated easily.Other similar DOM areas in javascript many cause the javascript parser to break too. § 2005-10-29T02:40:22Z § 2005-10-29T10:09:36Z

1424987 § FIXED § normal § defect § RESOLVED § Client Software § 16 § P2 § None§ 0§ 0§None§ 0§ 0§Since November 15th we see thousands of additional http requests coming to our SAP webshop server.The requests are calling our shop front page via our company webpage (www.hbm.com) which contains a link to the shop.This happens also with internal users opening only the internal webpage which also contains a link to the webshop. We have a colleague who opened the internal page for an hour this morning and had over 400 requests to the webshop in our log file. But she did not click on the webshop link at all. She is currently using Firefox 58.0b11 (64bit).So it seems that the new Firefox 57/58 is somehow scanning links in the background on our internal and external webpage and connecting the webshop behind hundreds of times. The Firefox user does not see these background connections.We have a serious issue with our webshop server as every request causes various connections to our SAP backend systems and slow them down.Please send emails answers to owp-support@hbm.com Thank you.Best regards

column4: we are suffering from compilation time creep and Xcode performance problem creep (navigating the project mainly)

column1: 1630149 § FIXED § -- § task § RESOLVED § Components § 4 § P1 § The failures fit in these categories:* Errors in the tests related a [bug in the Chrome implementation's number of input channels for inactive input](https://github.com/WebAudio/web-audio-api/issues/2177).* Features independent from AudioWorklet which are not implemented: [automationRate](https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1504984) and [offline suspend](https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1265406).* An existing [bug related to AudioBufferSourceNode](https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=916392#c12).§534§4§None§ 0§ 0§None§ 0§ 0§None§ 0§ 0§None§ 0§ 0§None§ 0§ 0§None§ 0§ 0§§0§0 § This bug is to record an analysis of the reasons for failures in AudioWorklet tests at https://hg.mozilla.org/mozilla-central/file/17e3c9ff2cad9711445a6c39df85925c8f347336/testing/web-platform/tests/webaudio/the-audio-api/the-audioworklet-interfaceThe failures fit in these categories:* Errors in the tests related a [bug in the Chrome implementation's number of input channels for inactive input](https://github.com/WebAudio/web-audio-api/issues/2177).* Features independent from AudioWorklet which are not implemented: [automationRate](https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1504984) and [offline suspend](https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1265406).* An existing [bug related to AudioBufferSourceNode](https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=916392#c12). § 2020-04-15T03:07:44Z § 2020-04-16T09:51:13Z

column1: 1644085 § FIXED § -- § enhancement § RESOLVED § Components § 158 § P1 § None§ 0§ 0§None§ 0§ 0§In GnuPG
column2: it is possible to set up groups which serve as aliases for multiple public keys [1]. Those groups can be specified e.g. in a configuration file (~/gnupg/gpg.conf). If the recipient is a group alias
column3: GnuPG automatically encrypts a message to all keys that are assigned to this group.This is especially useful for multiparty encryption to mailing lists (or rather distribution lists
column4: since all recipients have to be known by the sender).Enigmail supports multiparty encryption in two ways:* It can handle groups defined by GnuPG directly (since it merely calls gpg routines).* It provides "Per-Recipient Rules". This makes the assignment of multiple keys to one email address possible. [2]It currently looks like this functionality will be completely lost in future versions of Thunderbird
column5: and that there will be no adequate workaround. For users of groups (GnuPG) or Per-Recipient Rules (Enigmail)
column6: this will be a serious regression.Therefore
column7: this bug should propose the implementation of such a feature.[1] https://www.gnupg.org/documentation/manuals/gnupg/GPG-Key-related-Options.html#GPG-Key-related-Options[2] https://enigmail.net/index.php/en/user-manual/configuration#Per-Recipient_Rules§1213§9§None§ 0§ 0§None§ 0§ 0§None§ 0§ 0§: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:77.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/77.0§71§1§§0§0 § User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:77.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/77.0Steps to reproduce:In GnuPG
column8: it is possible to set up groups which serve as aliases for multiple public keys [1]. Those groups can be specified e.g. in a configuration file (~/gnupg/gpg.conf). If the recipient is a group alias
column9: GnuPG automatically encrypts a message to all keys that are assigned to this group.This is especially useful for multiparty encryption to mailing lists (or rather distribution lists
column10: since all recipients have to be known by the sender).Enigmail supports multiparty encryption in two ways:* It can handle groups defined by GnuPG directly (since it merely calls gpg routines).* It provides "Per-Recipient Rules". This makes the assignment of multiple keys to one email address possible. [2]It currently looks like this functionality will be completely lost in future versions of Thunderbird
column11: and that there will be no adequate workaround. For users of groups (GnuPG) or Per-Recipient Rules (Enigmail)
column12: this will be a serious regression.Therefore

1253865 § INVALID § normal § defect § RESOLVED § Client Software § 10 § P3 § None§ 0§ 0§None§ 0§ 0§Access gesetze-im-internet.de.§31§1§There should be a connection error ("Could not resolve host" or similar).This is the behaviour of tools like curl and also Chromium shows an error.This issue was discovered in https://github.com/EFForg/https-everywhere/pull/4266 and there you may also see more information.Note: In Tor Browser (Firefox/38.0 ESR) it fails
column2: which is the correct behaviour.§358§4§Firefox loads http://www.gesetze-im-internet.de/. However in the console no request to "http://gesetze-im-internet.de/" is shown as if I have never accessed/tried to access gesetze-im-internet.de.§197§1§None§ 0§ 0§: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:44.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/44.0Build ID: 20160210153822§100§2§§0§0 § User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:44.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/44.0Build ID: 20160210153822Steps to reproduce:Access gesetze-im-internet.de.Actual results:Firefox loads http://www.gesetze-im-internet.de/. However in the console no request to "http://gesetze-im-internet.de/" is shown as if I have never accessed/tried to access gesetze-im-internet.de.Expected results:There should be a connection error ("Could not resolve host" or similar).This is the behaviour of tools like curl and also Chromium shows an error.This issue was discovered in https://github.com/EFForg/https-everywhere/pull/4266 and there you may also see more information.Note: In Tor Browser (Firefox/38.0 ESR) it fails
column3: which is the correct behaviour. § 2016-03-05T21:24:43Z § 2020-11-03T17:09:42Z

column1: 1461592 § FIXED § normal § defect § RESOLVED § Client Software § 12 § -- § None§ 0§ 0§None§ 0§ 0§I downloaded the installer from https://ftp.mozilla.org/pub/firefox/releases/60.0esr/win64/fr/ and checked the integrity.Then I wanted to test installer options that I found here : https://firefox-source-docs.mozilla.org/browser/installer/windows/installer/FullConfig.htmlTherefore I ran (in a powershell terminal as administrator) :& ".\Firefox Setup 60.0esr.exe" /DesktopShortcut=false /StartMenuShortcut=false /TaskbarShortcut=true§438§4§With /DesktopShortcut=false /StartMenuShortcut=false /TaskbarShortcut=true
column2: the installer should create a taskbar shortcut but no desktop shortcut and no start menu shortcut.The standard installation with the GUI creates all three shortcuts.Test environment : Windows 7 Pro 64bit in VirtualBox§296§3§The installer seems to discard the command-line options : I get a desktop shortcut and a start menu shortcut but no taskbar shortcut.§134§1§None§ 0§ 0§: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Ubuntu; Linux x86_64; rv:59.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/59.0Build ID: 20180404120016§104§2§§0§0 § User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Ubuntu; Linux x86_64; rv:59.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/59.0Build ID: 20180404120016Steps to reproduce:I downloaded the installer from https://ftp.mozilla.org/pub/firefox/releases/60.0esr/win64/fr/ and checked the integrity.Then I wanted to test installer options that I found here : https://firefox-source-docs.mozilla.org/browser/installer/windows/installer/FullConfig.htmlTherefore I ran (in a powershell terminal as administrator) :& ".\Firefox Setup 60.0esr.exe" /DesktopShortcut=false /StartMenuShortcut=false /TaskbarShortcut=trueActual results:The installer seems to discard the command-line options : I get a desktop shortcut and a start menu shortcut but no taskbar shortcut.Expected results:With /DesktopShortcut=false /StartMenuShortcut=false /TaskbarShortcut=true
column3: the installer should create a taskbar shortcut but no desktop shortcut and no start menu shortcut.The standard installation with the GUI creates all three shortcuts.Test environment : Windows 7 Pro 64bit in VirtualBox § 2018-05-15T08:03:44Z § 2018-06-13T03:22:55Z

column1: 1709430 § FIXED § -- § defect § RESOLVED § Client Software § 12 § -- § None§ 0§ 0§None§ 0§ 0§I used these instructions for making Firefox the default web browser on Windows 10/2012 clients/servers: https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/make-firefox-enterprise-default-browser#firefox-enterprise:win10:Download the enterprise version of Firefox (either rapid release or ESR) and install on a Windows 10 or Windows 2012 client.  These instructions call for applying a GPO on Windows machines that calls a separate Default Associations xml document that looks like this:<DefaultAssociations> <Association Identifier=".htm" ProgId="FirefoxHTML" ApplicationName="Firefox" /> <Association Identifier=".html" ProgId="FirefoxHTML" ApplicationName="Firefox" /> <Association Identifier="http" ProgId="FirefoxHTML" ApplicationName="Firefox" /> <Association Identifier="https" ProgId="FirefoxHTML" ApplicationName="Firefox" /></DefaultAssociations>Put this file in a location that is accessible to the client and have the GPO point to that file (per the instructions linked above).  These same steps work just fine with Google Chrome using the exact same file at the same location if you just change the progid and application name to match what Google uses (ProgId="ChromeHTML" ApplicationName="Google Chrome") §1215§9§§0§0§When you follow these steps for Firefox
column2: and apply the GPO on the windows 10 client (applying the GPO with the command "gpupdate /force and logging out of Windows and back in) there will be no browser set as the default browser.  Opening an HTML document or clicking on an http/https link will bring up the Windows prompt to select the application you would like to be the default browser.If you manually make Firefox the default browser and logout and log back into Windows the problem returns since as expected the GPO applies again at login.  This problem does not occur if you perform the same steps but with/for Google Chrome.I believe the issue is related to the ProgID portion of the default associations xml document listed in the instructions.  If you manually set Firefox as the default web browser in Windows 10 or Windows 2012 and then go to:HKEY_CURRENT_USER\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\Shell\Associations\URLAssociations\(http|https)\UserChoiceit shows that the progid of Firefox is "FirefoxURL-308046B0AF4A39CB"If you edit the default associations xml document from the instructions above and change the http and https sections so that the progid is "FirefoxURL-308046B0AF4A39CB" the problem does not occur and everything works as expected.  If this progID changes periodically with updates then this will break GPO's that use this ProgID to make Firefox the default web browser.I reproduced this issue on multiple machines on new installs as well as machines where Firefox was already installed and just updated to the latest release.§1556§7§None§ 0§ 0§: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10.15; rv:88.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/88.0§85§1§§0§0 § User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10.15; rv:88.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/88.0Steps to reproduce:I used these instructions for making Firefox the default web browser on Windows 10/2012 clients/servers: https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/make-firefox-enterprise-default-browser#firefox-enterprise:win10:Download the enterprise version of Firefox (either rapid release or ESR) and install on a Windows 10 or Windows 2012 client.  These instructions call for applying a GPO on Windows machines that calls a separate Default Associations xml document that looks like this:<DefaultAssociations> <Association Identifier=".htm" ProgId="FirefoxHTML" ApplicationName="Firefox" /> <Association Identifier=".html" ProgId="FirefoxHTML" ApplicationName="Firefox" /> <Association Identifier="http" ProgId="FirefoxHTML" ApplicationName="Firefox" /> <Association Identifier="https" ProgId="FirefoxHTML" ApplicationName="Firefox" /></DefaultAssociations>Put this file in a location that is accessible to the client and have the GPO point to that file (per the instructions linked above).  These same steps work just fine with Google Chrome using the exact same file at the same location if you just change the progid and application name to match what Google uses (ProgId="ChromeHTML" ApplicationName="Google Chrome") Actual results:When you follow these steps for Firefox
column3: and apply the GPO on the windows 10 client (applying the GPO with the command "gpupdate /force and logging out of Windows and back in) there will be no browser set as the default browser.  Opening an HTML document or clicking on an http/https link will bring up the Windows prompt to select the application you would like to be the default browser.If you manually make Firefox the default browser and logout and log back into Windows the problem returns since as expected the GPO applies again at login.  This problem does not occur if you perform the same steps but with/for Google Chrome.I believe the issue is related to the ProgID portion of the default associations xml document listed in the instructions.  If you manually set Firefox as the default web browser in Windows 10 or Windows 2012 and then go to:HKEY_CURRENT_USER\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\Shell\Associations\URLAssociations\(http|https)\UserChoiceit shows that the progid of Firefox is "FirefoxURL-308046B0AF4A39CB"If you edit the default associations xml document from the instructions above and change the http and https sections so that the progid is "FirefoxURL-308046B0AF4A39CB" the problem does not occur and everything works as expected.  If this progID changes periodically with updates then this will break GPO's that use this ProgID to make Firefox the default web browser.I reproduced this issue on multiple machines on new installs as well as machines where Firefox was already installed and just updated to the latest release.Expected results:The expected result is that the GPO
column4: along with the default associations file should make Firefox the default application in Windows 10 clients whenever a user logs into windows (just as the instructions state).  Unfortunately this is broken. § 2021-05-04T18:35:10Z § 2021-05-07T15:02:00Z

column2: freezing system until I hit ctrl+alt+del - in addition
column3: this combination worked only after some time
column4: like 30 secs. That unfreezed Salamander and task was completed without problem. I was investigating this for some time and found out that uninstalling Firefox 2 stopped this behavior. After some experiments I found out there is strange process named firefox.exe
column5: with very low memory consumtion (1-3 MB RAM and 3-5 MB virtual memory) but with 100% CPU usage. When I killed the process
column6: it was back running in half a minute. I noticed there is a process named msmsrs.exe that started few seconds before this strange firefox.exe popped in and it ends as soon as strange firefox.exe is started. Registry scan revealed only one connection to msmsrs.exe - c:\program files\drivers\msmsrs.exe . When I killed strange firefox.exe again
column7: I moved msmrsr.exe to another directory and deleted its registry values (msmsrs was constantly adding this registry again when it was left intact and in original directory). It seems thats all I needed to do to get my computer cleared again. As I am not the only one using my PC
column8: I was unable to find out where this infection came from.I found out this behavior:1) After execution
column9: this program coppies itself into c:\program files\drivers dir.2) It adds itself into registry
column10: registry values included in zip file.3) It uses Firefox to secretly connect to internet (most probably IP 89.53.39.44)
column11: clearly to avoid firewall detection.4) Task manager reports this program (or
column12: firefox.exe that is started by this program) uses 100% of CPU.5) When registry values are deleted
column13: it adds them again.6) If this program or firefox.exe is killed
column14: it runs itself again in half a minute (aproximately).7) c:\program files\drivers contained only two files - msmsrs.exe and klog.dat (sounds like keylogger
column15: which
column16: of course
column17: can be quite dangereous). I am not adding this klog.dat file because I don't know what it contains and I fear it can contain private informations - if it will be needed for you to analyze this program
column18: I will concider adding it on your demand.I don't know what this program really does
column19: but it clearly has dangerous behavior typical for spyware/malware - unfortunately my BitDefender Plus antivirus did not noticed it and its firewall was worthless because msmsrs.exe used Firefox to connect.Hope it helps. I sent copy of this report to SOFTWIN company (creators of BitDefender) for their analysis as well.Petr Kovarik

column1: 1631856 § FIXED § -- § task § RESOLVED § Client Software § 23 § P1 § None§ 0§ 0§None§ 0§ 0§None§ 0§ 0§None§ 0§ 0§None§ 0§ 0§None§ 0§ 0§None§ 0§ 0§## Proposal for changing an existing or adding a new Glean metric type### Who is the individual/team requesting this change?Frank Bertsch### Is this about changing an existing metric type or creating a new one?Creating a new metric type### Can you describe the data that needs to be recorded?This issue is for recording rates. Rates are essentially two counters; one for the numerator and one for the denominator. Take an example from [application services](https://github.com/mozilla/application-services/blob/master/components/places/android/metrics.yaml). They record the `read_query_count` and `read_query_error_count`
column2: and use that to ascertain the read query error rate.It is possible to create this from existing metrics
column3: but the big win here would be enabling this data in GLAM
column4: and having solid ways of querying it in BQ
column5: Things to consider:- Can we use existing counters as parts of the rate? i.e. define a rate
column6: with the denominator being an already-collected counter.- Can we define the rate abstraction on top of existing metrics
column7: without every implementing it in the ping? i.e. use counters for numerator and denominator. (difficulty is how to query with this)### Can you provide a raw sample of the data that needs to be recorded (this is in the abstract
column8: and not any particular implementation details about its representation in the payload or the database)Here's another - % of page loads that are reader mode capable. Fraction of url bar presses that search.### What is the business question/use-case that requires the data to be recorded?See above.### How would the data be consumed?1. GLAM dashboard especially would show rates with client experience of each rate.2. BQ querying would have some nice UDFs to make this easy.### Why existing metric types are not enough?Lots of custom SQL
column9: cannot see these in GLAM.### What is the timeline by which the data needs to be collected?No timeline.§1931§22 § ## Proposal for changing an existing or adding a new Glean metric type### Who is the individual/team requesting this change?Frank Bertsch### Is this about changing an existing metric type or creating a new one?Creating a new metric type### Can you describe the data that needs to be recorded?This issue is for recording rates. column1: 381959 § INCOMPLETE § major § defect § RESOLVED § Client Software § 4 § -- § None§ 0§ 0§None§ 0§ 0§1. Open Up firefox and setup proxy settings2. Setup your proxy and the connection settings for it. This happens for all possible settings:a. Auto-detectb. Manual Proxy Configurationc. Automatic proxy configuration URL3. Close settings and restart firefox.4. Try to access an internal URL - works fine5. Try to access external URL - get "The connection has timed out". §376§8§None§ 0§ 0§A prompt for the Proxy authenticationIt appears there is a problem with sending the HTTP headers. I have tested this out with the same version of firefox on Windows XP SP1 and The http headers look like this when making the request and responce:Request:Host=www.google.com.au§280§5§: Always§9§1§=Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 6.0; en-US; rv:1.8.1.3) Gecko/20070309 Firefox/2.0.0.3Accept=text/xml
column2: application/xml
column3: application/xhtml+xml
column4: text/html;q=0.9
column5: text/plain;q=0.8
column6: image/png
column7: */*;q=0.5Accept-Language=en-us
column8: en;q=0.5Accept-Encoding=gzip
column9: deflateAccept-Charset=ISO-8859-1

column14: there is no HTTP proxy details sent in the HTTP headers when trying to request a URL as a result all requests are coming back with "The connection has timed out".Reproducible: AlwaysSteps to Reproduce:1. Open Up firefox and setup proxy settings2. Setup your proxy and the connection settings for it. This happens for all possible settings:a. Auto-detectb. Manual Proxy Configurationc. Automatic proxy configuration URL3. Close settings and restart firefox.4. Try to access an internal URL - works fine5. Try to access external URL - get "The connection has timed out". Actual Actual results:  "The connection has timed out" firefox pageExpected Actual results:  A prompt for the Proxy authenticationIt appears there is a problem with sending the HTTP headers. I have tested this out with the same version of firefox on Windows XP SP1 and The http headers look like this when making the request and responce:Request:Host=www.google.com.auUser Agent=Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.8.1.3) Gecko/20070309 Firefox/2.0.0.3Accept=image/png

column1: 294674 § INCOMPLETE § major § defect § RESOLVED § Client Software § 9 § -- § None§ 0§ 0§None§ 0§ 0§Test case files:/image1.png/image2.png/test/image3.png/test/editor/image4.png/test/editor/test.html/test/editor/test.iframe.html1) Open the "http://editor.hardcoreinternet.co.uk/test/editor/test.html" webpage in the web browser.Four images are display correctly in the editable "content" iframe. The imageand link addresses are correctly resolved relative to the iframe's "base href"as they should be.2) Select the "View HTML" button to view the HTML code from the "content" iframe.The HTML code is:3) Focus the "content" iframe with the four images and select all the content(i.e. using CTRL+A).4) Copy or cut all the content (i.e. using CTRL+C or CTRL+X)5) Paste the content back into the "content" iframe (i.e. using CTRL+V)Only two of the four images are now displayed and the two other images are "broken".6) Select the "View HTML" button to view the HTML code from the "content" iframe.§1144§24§None§ 0§ 0§Solution: Copy/cut/paste should not modify the image and link addresses.The HTML code should still be:§336§6§: Always§9§1§: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.7.8) Gecko/20050511 Firefox/1.0.4Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.7.8) Gecko/20050511 Firefox/1.0.4We use Midas/designMode="on" and iframes to implement a web content editor.Unfortunately
column2: copy/cut/paste within the designMode="on" iframe ignores theiframe's "base href" and uses the iframe's document location instead. The resultis that the image and link addresses in the cut/copied/pasted content arechanged/corrupted.Importance: This is a major problem for Mozilla's/Firefox's use in web contentmanagement systems etc. with Midas/designMode-based web content editors. Usersrisk breaking the edited content (unless they manually repair the corruptedimage/link addresses after using copy/cut/paste - a cumbersome and error proneprocess).§849§12§§0§0 § User Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.7.8) Gecko/20050511 Firefox/1.0.4Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.7.8) Gecko/20050511 Firefox/1.0.4We use Midas/designMode="on" and iframes to implement a web content editor.Unfortunately
column3: copy/cut/paste within the designMode="on" iframe ignores theiframe's "base href" and uses the iframe's document location instead. The resultis that the image and link addresses in the cut/copied/pasted content arechanged/corrupted.Importance: This is a major problem for Mozilla's/Firefox's use in web contentmanagement systems etc. with Midas/designMode-based web content editors. Usersrisk breaking the edited content (unless they manually repair the corruptedimage/link addresses after using copy/cut/paste - a cumbersome and error proneprocess).Reproducible: every time (including testing a number of differentMidas/designMode-based web content editor products from different vendors).Reproducible: AlwaysSteps to Reproduce:Test case files:/image1.png/image2.png/test/image3.png/test/editor/image4.png/test/editor/test.html/test/editor/test.iframe.html1) Open the "http://editor.hardcoreinternet.co.uk/test/editor/test.html" webpage in the web browser.Four images are display correctly in the editable "content" iframe. The imageand link addresses are correctly resolved relative to the iframe's "base href"as they should be.2) Select the "View HTML" button to view the HTML code from the "content" iframe.The HTML code is:3) Focus the "content" iframe with the four images and select all the content(i.e. using CTRL+A).4) Copy or cut all the content (i.e. using CTRL+C or CTRL+X)5) Paste the content back into the "content" iframe (i.e. using CTRL+V)Only two of the four images are now displayed and the two other images are "broken".6) Select the "View HTML" button to view the HTML code from the "content" iframe.Actual Actual results: The HTML code is now:The "a href" and "img src" addresses have been changed to be relative to theiframe's document location instead of being relative to the iframe's "basehref". All eight image/link addresses are wrong (although two of the images arestill displayed). The web browser still tries to resolve the image and linkaddresses relative to the iframe's "base href" as they should be
column4: but the imageand link addresses in the content are now relative to the iframe's documentlocation.Expected Actual results: Solution: Copy/cut/paste should not modify the image and link addresses.The HTML code should still be: § 2005-05-18T17:32:15Z § 2021-09-29T12:36:13Z

Install Java plugin from JRE 1.6.0:  ln -s /opt/java/jdk/1.6.0/jre/plugin/i386/ns7/libjavaplugin_oji.so /usr/lib/firefox-2.0.0.1/plugins8. Restart firefox9. View URL "about:plugins"§467§11§None§ 0§ 0§In step 9 the page should have displayed Java plugin version "1.6.0-b105"To correct this the user must edit manually the $HOME/.mozilla/firefox/pluginreg.dat file (which says "do not edit" on the first line) and remove all information about the Java plugin.10. Edit Remove all information about Java plugins from 11. Restart firefox12. View URL "about:plugins"§365§5§: Always§9§1§:       Mozilla/5.0 (X11; U; Linux i686; en-US; rv:1.8.1.1) Gecko/20061208 Firefox/2.0.0.1Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; U; Linux i686; en-US; rv:1.8.1.1) Gecko/20061208 Firefox/2.0.0.1The "about:plugins" page does not update the plugin version information when the Java plugin is installed manually from a JDK that is already installed on the computer.§361§3§§0§0 § User Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (X11; U; Linux i686; en-US; rv:1.8.1.1) Gecko/20061208 Firefox/2.0.0.1Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; U; Linux i686; en-US; rv:1.8.1.1) Gecko/20061208 Firefox/2.0.0.1The "about:plugins" page does not update the plugin version information when the Java plugin is installed manually from a JDK that is already installed on the computer.Reproducible: AlwaysSteps to Reproduce:1. Remove symbolic link created in step 1.5. Restart firefox6. View URL "about:plugins"7. Install Java plugin from JRE 1.6.0:  ln -s /opt/java/jdk/1.6.0/jre/plugin/i386/ns7/libjavaplugin_oji.so /usr/lib/firefox-2.0.0.1/plugins8. Restart firefox9. column24: §1976§36 § The goal here is to implement the `CSS_MESSAGE` resource from the actor side.This is about replicating the current behavior
column25: implemented in bug 1625910.But instead of having a wrapper on the client side to morph the legacy WebConsoleActor methods (i.e. the legacy listener code)
column26: we would implement an actor API matching ResourceWatcher API (i.e. watch and unwatch).This would be about implementing a server side equivalent of this legacy listener code:https://searchfox.org/mozilla-central/source/devtools/shared/resources/legacy-listeners/css-messages.jsIn a new server side module:https://searchfox.org/mozilla-central/source/devtools/server/actors/resources/css-messages.jsThis module would typicaly look like this:```const { TYPES } = require("devtools/server/actors/resources/index");class MyResourceWatcher {  /**   * Start watching for all ${MY_RESOURCE_TYPE} related to a given Target Actor.   * This will notify about existing ${MY_RESOURCE_TYPE}
column27: but also the one created in future.   *   * @param TargetActor targetActor   *        The target actor from which we should observe console messages   * @param Object options   *        Dictionary object with following attributes:   *        - onAvailable: mandatory function   *          This will be called for each resource.   */  constructor(targetActor
column29: we already have some helper class which helps observing one resource    // that we can spawn like this:    // Note that it may often be easier to merge such `MyResourceListener` into this `MyResourceWatcher` class!    const listener = new MyResourceListener(      targetActor.browsingContextID
column31: ...  /* whatever is useful for your observation */    );        // Forward all future resources being observed to the upper layer calling this module
column32: // via `onAvailable` callback argument.    // I'm using EventEmitter API here
column34: // based on the platform API we have to use to observe the resource.    listener.on("one-of-my-resource-is-created"
column35: resource => {      // We have to ensure that each resource object has a valid `resourceType` attribute      resource.resourceType = TYPES.MY_RESOURCE_TYPE;      onAvailable([resource]);    });        // Also forward all resources which already exist when we are calling this method    // (if any exists)    const cachedResources = listener.getAllAlreadyExistingOrCachedResources();    for(const resource of cachedResources) {      resource.resourceType = TYPES.MY_RESOURCE_TYPE;    }    onAvailable(cachedResources);        // Save the listener in order to destroy/stop watching later on.    this.listener = listener;  }  /**   * Stop watching for ${MY_RESOURCE_TYPE}.   */  destroy() {    if (this.listener) {      this.listener.destroy();    }  }}module.exports = MyResourceWatcher;```An important goal here is to emit the exact same `resource` object that the legacy listener is passing to its `onAvailable` callback.Same attributes
column37: ...Bug 1644185 could be used as a template. As it did this work for `PLATFORM_MESSAGE` resource type.The main reason to do this is to be able to start listening to the resource before the page starts loading.Thanks to the framework work done in bug 1620243
column38: this `MyResourceWatcher` class will be instantiated before the page starts loading and possibly as early as the content process just started. This wasn't the case with legacy actor APIs like `WebConsoleActor.startListeners`
column40: ...We were calling these methods too late
column41: only after the frontend is notify about the existance of the target
column43: late after the page started loading.You will also have to register this new module in this registry:https://searchfox.org/mozilla-central/source/devtools/server/actors/resources/index.js* Add a new entry in `TYPES` object.* Register your new resource watcher module into `Resources` object.Last but not least
column44: it is probably a good time to review the existing tests for this Resource:https://searchfox.org/mozilla-central/source/devtools/shared/resources/testsAnd ensure that it has a good coverage.You would especially have to migrate all Client/Front tests
column45: which were testing the backend behavior via `targetFront.getFront("myfront")`.All these tests will be removed

column1: 936973 § WONTFIX § minor § defect § RESOLVED § Client Software § 18 § P3 § None§ 0§ 0§None§ 0§ 0§Install FF 24 ESR.Download a number of files.Open Downloads (Tools/Downloads).View downloads.§97§4§Half the space could have been used.The new Downloads in the Library is a great idea but using so much space is inconsisant with History and Bookmarks. There is no space between these.The old browser.download.useToolkitUI method used more space than it needed to but would often lock up FF while the download window was open so I would prefer the new way. It's been open for 30 mins and no sign of excess cpu use.§417§4§Too much wasted space between items listed.§44§1§None§ 0§ 0§: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:24.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/24.0 (Beta/Release)Build ID: 20131030130144§111§2§§0§0 § User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:24.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/24.0 (Beta/Release)Build ID: 20131030130144Steps to reproduce:Install FF 24 ESR.Download a number of files.Open Downloads (Tools/Downloads).View downloads.Actual results:Too much wasted space between items listed.Expected results:Half the space could have been used.The new Downloads in the Library is a great idea but using so much space is inconsisant with History and Bookmarks. There is no space between these.The old browser.download.useToolkitUI method used more space than it needed to but would often lock up FF while the download window was open so I would prefer the new way. It's been open for 30 mins and no sign of excess cpu use. § 2013-11-11T02:00:59Z § 2017-05-22T19:58:52Z

column1: 1632237 § FIXED § -- § enhancement § RESOLVED § Client Software § 14 § P1 § None§ 0§ 0§None§ 0§ 0§None§ 0§ 0§None§ 0§ 0§None§ 0§ 0§None§ 0§ 0§None§ 0§ 0§For those apps that migrate to Glean
column2: it would be nice to be able to take advantage of the deletion-request ping functionality in Glean to have the information to also delete legacy telemetry.  This is especially important for apps that are migrating to Glean since they may not have a way to delete legacy telemetry and it's very possible that Glean and legacy telemetry are running side-by-side.This may be as simple as adding a UUID metric to the app's metrics.yaml file with a `sendInPings` of `deletion-request`.§519§2 § For those apps that migrate to Glean
column3: it would be nice to be able to take advantage of the deletion-request ping functionality in Glean to have the information to also delete legacy telemetry.  This is especially important for apps that are migrating to Glean since they may not have a way to delete legacy telemetry and it's very possible that Glean and legacy telemetry are running side-by-side.This may be as simple as adding a UUID metric to the app's metrics.yaml file with a `sendInPings` of `deletion-request`. § 2020-04-22T17:30:26Z § 2020-04-30T12:07:49Z

column2: andjust like non-GKT2 builds of Firebird do.§121§2§: Always§9§1§:       Mozilla/5.0 (X11; U; Linux i686; en-US; rv:1.5b) Gecko/20030916 Firebird/0.6.1+Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; U; Linux i686; en-US; rv:1.5b) Gecko/20030916 Firebird/0.6.1+Firebird built with GTK2 doesn't seem to pay any attention to the definitions ofwhat dead keys (e.g. "dead_circumflex") set in /usr/X11R6/lib/X11/locale/en_US.UTF-8/Compose (in RedHat 9). Instead it seems touse some default definitions. Thus "dead_circumflex" + a does produce "â"

column12: but this is just my quick and dirty test code to verify the bug.So I have 5 instances of tstFoo.htm in frames 1 to 5. The page in the top frame doesn't do anything
column13: and the page in the bottom frame (tstFooValidate.htm) has a 'GO' button and some JavaScript code that iterates the contents of each instance of tstFoo.htm and tells us the value of each text field foo.htm (there's only 1). Works fine in IE 5.5 or Opera versions 6 or 7.Here is the JavaScript code:<script language="JavaScript">	function GoValidate() {		for (var i = 1; i <= 5; i++) {			// Seems to be this line that doesn't work in FireFox:			// (although it works in Opera and IE)			var sVal = parent.frames[i].frmFoo.txtFoo.value;// show me:alert ("sVal = " + sVal);		} // next i	} // end function</script>The Firefox JavaScript Console tells me:Error: parent.frames[i].frmFoo has no propertiesSource File: http://192.168.0.101/phptest/tstFooValidate.htmLine: 14That's this line:var sVal = parent.frames[i].frmFoo.txtFoo.value;I don't think so. My JavaScript book ('JavaScript Bible
column14: Gold Edition' by Danny Goodman) tells me that that syntax is a valid and legal way to address frames in a child->parent->other child relationship (plus it works in those other browsers).Is it perhaps not interpreting 'i' properly? column1: 1631863 § FIXED § -- § enhancement § RESOLVED § Components § 5 § P1 § None§ 0§ 0§None§ 0§ 0§None§ 0§ 0§None§ 0§ 0§None§ 0§ 0§None§ 0§ 0§None§ 0§ 0§This is needed for notifying PreloaderBase when channels are switched during redirect.  There is a check in PreloaderBase that the start and stop notifications come from the right channel.  This check is needed when a preload is restarted with a new channel while the old channel has not delivered the stop notification so far to prevent logic break (prevent duplication of notifications and keep assumptions about the stop status inside PreloaderBase).§454§1 § This is needed for notifying PreloaderBase when channels are switched during redirect. column1: 1632846 § FIXED § -- § task § RESOLVED § Components § 5 § P1 § None§ 0§ 0§None§ 0§ 0§None§ 0§ 0§None§ 0§ 0§None§ 0§ 0§None§ 0§ 0§None§ 0§ 0§Some auto rooters get marked on every GC slice
column2: but there are some things we can do to optimise this.  For example
column3: it's not necessary to mark a value more than once in the same GC. Some background as to why we do this: https://searchfox.org/mozilla-central/source/js/src/vm/Compartment.h#453-467§298§2 § Some auto rooters get marked on every GC slice
column4: but there are some things we can do to optimise this.  For example

1637956 § FIXED § -- § defect § RESOLVED § Client Software § 6 § P1 § None§ 0§ 0§None§ 0§ 0§None§ 0§ 0§None§ 0§ 0§None§ 0§ 0§None§ 0§ 0§None§ 0§ 0§I am testing MozPhab code.It is working fine (pings are successfully submitted to telemetry).Testing metrics within the `mozphab.user` category is crashing the test process.metrics.yaml```mozphab.user:  installation:    type: uuid    description: >        Unique identifier of each MozPhab installation.        A user might install the application on multiple machines/profiles.    lifetime: user    notification_emails:      - mozphab-telemetry@mozilla.com      - pzalewa@mozilla.com    bugs:      - https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1621025    data_reviews:      - https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1621025#c2    expires: never    send_in_pings:      - usage  id:    type: uuid    description: >        Unique identifier of each MozPhab user.    lifetime: user    notification_emails:      - mozphab-telemetry@mozilla.com      - pzalewa@mozilla.com    bugs:      - https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1621025    data_reviews:      - https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1621025#c2    expires: never    send_in_pings:      - usage```test file.Working code:```    assert "10.0.18362" == t.metrics.mozphab.environment.os_version.test_get_value()```Crashing code:```    assert t.metrics.mozphab.user.installation.test_has_value()```or```    assert "install_id" == t.metrics.mozphab.user.installation.test_get_value()```§1407§51 § I am testing MozPhab code.It is working fine (pings are successfully submitted to telemetry).Testing metrics within the `mozphab.user` category is crashing the test process.metrics.yaml```mozphab.user:  installation:    type: uuid    description: >        Unique identifier of each MozPhab installation.        A user might install the application on multiple machines/profiles.    lifetime: user    notification_emails:      - mozphab-telemetry@mozilla.com      - pzalewa@mozilla.com    bugs:      - https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1621025    data_reviews:      - https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1621025#c2    expires: never    send_in_pings:      - usage  id:    type: uuid    description: >        Unique identifier of each MozPhab user.    lifetime: user    notification_emails:      - mozphab-telemetry@mozilla.com      - pzalewa@mozilla.com    bugs:      - https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1621025    data_reviews:      - https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1621025#c2    expires: never    send_in_pings:      - usage```test file.Working code:```    assert "10.0.18362" == t.metrics.mozphab.environment.os_version.test_get_value()```Crashing code:```    assert t.metrics.mozphab.user.installation.test_has_value()```or```    assert "install_id" == t.metrics.mozphab.user.installation.test_get_value()``` § 2020-05-14T13:18:11Z § 2020-05-27T09:49:42Z

column1: 1114311 § INVALID § normal § defect § RESOLVED § Client Software § 4 § P1 § None§ 0§ 0§None§ 0§ 0§Went to this web site:The actual URL: http://harimaga.blogspot.com/ Its 'convenience' URL is:http://blog.ahangama.com/If you check the source code
column2: you will see the following line in it that makes the alias URL:<link href='http://blog.ahangama.com/' rel='canonical'/>(See: http://googlewebmastercentral.blogspot.com/2009/02/specify-your-canonical.html)Also please notice that the font is called with this CSS rule:@font-face{font-family:samagana;src:url(http://ahangama.com/woff/samagana.woff) format("woff");}§520§10§The web page (a blog at blogspot.com) should show the text in the hosted web font. I tested the font for errors. Also tested the .htacess file. It has the correct directive that is working properly on another web font server. (smartfonts.net)I think that FF expects the URL for the font to be a relative address because the domain of the blog and the web font appear to be the same. A complication is that the blog's real domain is blogspot.com though its alias or 'canonical' URL is from ahangama.com.I cannot change the CSS of the blog right now because Google seems to have withdrawn that facility. Besides
column3: that could break proper display by all other browsers.My humble suggestion is for Firefox to go by the IP address than the name of the domains when deciding if a web font is legitimately hosted.Thanks.JCPS: The web font attached§846§7§Firefox does not show the font that showed well all this while since 2009. This happened soon after I updated the font. None of the other browsers have this problem. I tested this in Windows 7
column4: XP and Puppy Linux. The problem is isolated to Firefox only.§255§1§None§ 0§ 0§: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; rv:34.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/34.0Build ID: 20141126041045§93§2§§0§0 § User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; rv:34.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/34.0Build ID: 20141126041045Steps to reproduce:Went to this web site:The actual URL: http://harimaga.blogspot.com/ Its 'convenience' URL is:http://blog.ahangama.com/If you check the source code
column5: you will see the following line in it that makes the alias URL:<link href='http://blog.ahangama.com/' rel='canonical'/>(See: http://googlewebmastercentral.blogspot.com/2009/02/specify-your-canonical.html)Also please notice that the font is called with this CSS rule:@font-face{font-family:samagana;src:url(http://ahangama.com/woff/samagana.woff) format("woff");}Actual results:Firefox does not show the font that showed well all this while since 2009. This happened soon after I updated the font. None of the other browsers have this problem. I tested this in Windows 7
column6: XP and Puppy Linux. The problem is isolated to Firefox only.Expected results:The web page (a blog at blogspot.com) should show the text in the hosted web font. I tested the font for errors. Also tested the .htacess file. It has the correct directive that is working properly on another web font server. (smartfonts.net)I think that FF expects the URL for the font to be a relative address because the domain of the blog and the web font appear to be the same. A complication is that the blog's real domain is blogspot.com though its alias or 'canonical' URL is from ahangama.com.I cannot change the CSS of the blog right now because Google seems to have withdrawn that facility. Besides
column7: that could break proper display by all other browsers.My humble suggestion is for Firefox to go by the IP address than the name of the domains when deciding if a web font is legitimately hosted.Thanks.JCPS: The web font attached § 2014-12-21T06:03:24Z § 2014-12-24T03:14:32Z

column1: 1640757 § FIXED § -- § defect § RESOLVED § Components § 6 § P1 § None§ 0§ 0§None§ 0§ 0§None§ 0§ 0§None§ 0§ 0§None§ 0§ 0§None§ 0§ 0§None§ 0§ 0§`runjunit.py` supports multiple test filters [in theory](https://searchfox.org/mozilla-central/rev/ea7f70dac1c5fd18400f6d2a92679777d4b21492/testing/mochitest/runjunit.py#162)
column2: however when the tests actually run
column3: only the final test specified in the list of filters is executed.According to the [`am instrument` documentation](https://developer.android.com/reference/androidx/test/runner/AndroidJUnitRunner#typical-usage)
column4: `-e class` may be used to run a single test.OTOH
column5: it looks to me like the way to get multiple filters to work is to push a text file to the device that containing the list of tests to run
column6: and then specifying that file using `-e testFile`.§665§3 § `runjunit.py` supports multiple test filters [in theory](https://searchfox.org/mozilla-central/rev/ea7f70dac1c5fd18400f6d2a92679777d4b21492/testing/mochitest/runjunit.py#162)
column7: however when the tests actually run
column8: only the final test specified in the list of filters is executed.According to the [`am instrument` documentation](https://developer.android.com/reference/androidx/test/runner/AndroidJUnitRunner#typical-usage)
column9: `-e class` may be used to run a single test.OTOH
column10: it looks to me like the way to get multiple filters to work is to push a text file to the device that containing the list of tests to run
column11: and then specifying that file using `-e testFile`. § 2020-05-25T22:30:09Z § 2020-05-27T03:56:34Z

column1: 1634353 § FIXED § -- § defect § RESOLVED § Client Software § 2 § P1 § None§ 0§ 0§None§ 0§ 0§None§ 0§ 0§None§ 0§ 0§None§ 0§ 0§None§ 0§ 0§None§ 0§ 0§We detected a slight issue when 2 pings are getting submitted in close succession.The first will trigger an upload worker to be scheduled
column2: which then scans the pending pings directory and starts uploading.The second upload worker doesn't do anything
column3: due to the `KEEP` policy we enforce.The second ping thus is missed (as no directory re-scan happens)
column4: and only uploaded the next time an upload worker starts.The new upload mechanism potentially fixes that
column5: however we should add an explicit test for this.§511§5 § We detected a slight issue when 2 pings are getting submitted in close succession.The first will trigger an upload worker to be scheduled
column6: which then scans the pending pings directory and starts uploading.The second upload worker doesn't do anything
column7: due to the `KEEP` policy we enforce.The second ping thus is missed (as no directory re-scan happens)
column8: and only uploaded the next time an upload worker starts.The new upload mechanism potentially fixes that
column9: however we should add an explicit test for this. § 2020-04-30T12:02:19Z § 2020-05-11T09:54:01Z

column1: 1566779 § INCOMPLETE § normal § defect § RESOLVED § Client Software § 14 § P3 § None§ 0§ 0§None§ 0§ 0§- Install/upgrade to Firefox 68 on Windows Server 2008 R2 with Citrix XenApp 6.5.- launch Firefox via Citrix Receiver or Citrix Receiver in a browser page.When launching Firefox 68 64bit (both normal and ESR versions) via Citrix Receiver in a XenApp 6.5 on Windows 2008 R2 environment an Illegal Instruction Exception is produced (see attached image). After clicking 'OK' to close the application
column2: the application window remains open and Firefox is responsive to some commands (opening/closing tabs
column3: options
column4: Content Blocking
column5: etc.) although not reliably. No Web pages can be displayed.- Hotfix Rollup Pack 7 for Citrix XenApp 6.5 for Microsoft Windows Server 2008 R2 is installed.- Problem occurs with both Citrix Receiver 4.4 and 4.9.- Firefox 67 64bit functions correctly but if it is allowed to update to version 68 then the error is produced as soon as it relaunches.- A clean install of version 68 produces the error.- 32 bit versions of Firefox 68 function correctly without error.- Disabling all Citrix API hooks for the firefox.exe executable via the registry resolves the problem.- Disabling only the Citrix 'Special Folder Redirection' hook (sfrHook) via the registry resolves the problem.- Disabling the Special Folder Redirection Citrix policy in the Citrix AppCenter GUI does not appear to resolve the problem (I'm not 100% certain on this point).- When when attempting to display a Web page in a new tab the 'loading' animation to the left of the tab's name appears but the page never loads.- Exactly the same behaviour described above is seen when connecting to the Citrix server via RDP.§1617§13§- Firefox 68 should function as Firefox 67 did.§48§1§None§ 0§ 0§None§ 0§ 0§: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:68.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/68.0§81§1§§0§0 § User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:68.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/68.0Steps to reproduce:- Install/upgrade to Firefox 68 on Windows Server 2008 R2 with Citrix XenApp 6.5.- launch Firefox via Citrix Receiver or Citrix Receiver in a browser page.When launching Firefox 68 64bit (both normal and ESR versions) via Citrix Receiver in a XenApp 6.5 on Windows 2008 R2 environment an Illegal Instruction Exception is produced (see attached image). After clicking 'OK' to close the application
column6: the application window remains open and Firefox is responsive to some commands (opening/closing tabs
column7: options
column8: Content Blocking
column9: etc.) although not reliably. No Web pages can be displayed.- Hotfix Rollup Pack 7 for Citrix XenApp 6.5 for Microsoft Windows Server 2008 R2 is installed.- Problem occurs with both Citrix Receiver 4.4 and 4.9.- Firefox 67 64bit functions correctly but if it is allowed to update to version 68 then the error is produced as soon as it relaunches.- A clean install of version 68 produces the error.- 32 bit versions of Firefox 68 function correctly without error.- Disabling all Citrix API hooks for the firefox.exe executable via the registry resolves the problem.- Disabling only the Citrix 'Special Folder Redirection' hook (sfrHook) via the registry resolves the problem.- Disabling the Special Folder Redirection Citrix policy in the Citrix AppCenter GUI does not appear to resolve the problem (I'm not 100% certain on this point).- When when attempting to display a Web page in a new tab the 'loading' animation to the left of the tab's name appears but the page never loads.- Exactly the same behaviour described above is seen when connecting to the Citrix server via RDP.Expected results:- Firefox 68 should function as Firefox 67 did. § 2019-07-17T10:26:45Z § 2021-02-26T16:00:06Z

Open the browser with the profile from prerequisites.2. Navigate to the "about:newtab" page.3. Resize the browser's width to the minimum allowed.4. Hover the snippet.5. Observe the way the snippet's elements rendered.§225§5§- All the elements are rendered correctly.§43§1§- The highlight and the Dismiss button exceed the borders of the snippet. **[Notes]:**§88§2§- Will update the report after checking if this issue is reproducible on other OSes.§85§1§None§ 0§ 0§**[Affected Versions]:**- Firefox Release 74.0 - Build ID: 20200309095159- Firefox Release 75.0 - Build ID: 20200403170909- Firefox Release 76.0 - Build ID: 20200429185419- Firefox Release 77.0.1 - Build ID: 20200602222727§227§5 § **[Affected Versions]:**- Firefox Release 74.0 - Build ID: 20200309095159- Firefox Release 75.0 - Build ID: 20200403170909- Firefox Release 76.0 - Build ID: 20200429185419- Firefox Release 77.0.1 - Build ID: 20200602222727**[Affected Platforms]:**- All Windows**[Preconditions]:**- Have a Firefox en-US locale build installed.- Have a Firefox profile older than 17 weeks. In order to do that you can change the creation date from the "times.json" file that can be found in the current profile folder.- Have the following pref in the "about:config" page:	- "browser.newtabpage.activity-stream.asrouter.providers.snippets" pref value set to "{"id":"snippets"

column3: type:"remote"
column4: url:"https://snippets.cdn.mozilla.net/%STARTPAGE_VERSION%/%NAME%/%VERSION%/%APPBUILDID%/%BUILD_TARGET%/%LOCALE%/%CHANNEL%/%OS_VERSION%/experiment-202007-hvmt/%DISteps to reproduceIBUTION_VERSION%/"
column5: updateCycleInMs:14400000}".	- "browser.search.region" pref value must not be set to "US".**[Steps to reproduce]:**1. Open the browser with the profile from prerequisites.2. Navigate to the "about:newtab" page.3. Resize the browser's width to the minimum allowed.4. Hover the snippet.5. Observe the way the snippet's elements rendered.**[Expected results]:**- All the elements are rendered correctly.**Actual results]:**- The highlight and the Dismiss button exceed the borders of the snippet. **[Notes]:**- This issue is reproducible with all 3 snippets.- Attached is a screenshot of the issue along with the tested versions of Firefox.- Will update the report after checking if this issue is reproducible on other OSes. § 2020-06-11T16:31:43Z § 2020-11-02T16:33:24Z

column1: 1640684 § FIXED § -- § task § RESOLVED § Components § 8 § P1 § None§ 0§ 0§None§ 0§ 0§None§ 0§ 0§None§ 0§ 0§None§ 0§ 0§None§ 0§ 0§None§ 0§ 0§This bug is for converting the verbose way of showing the tests in the [raptor perfdocs page](https://firefox-source-docs.mozilla.org/testing/perfdocs/raptor.html) into a list of tests.For instance
column2: the desktop suite would become:```DesktopTests for page-load performance.* Browsertime amazon* Browsertime bing-search* ...```Note how the descriptions are not inserted. We will be able to make use of the changes made in this bug: https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1637058Instead of returning a section with a header we would do the following (which builds a list):```return ["* " + title]```§616§14 § This bug is for converting the verbose way of showing the tests in the [raptor perfdocs page](https://firefox-source-docs.mozilla.org/testing/perfdocs/raptor.html) into a list of tests.For instance
column3: the desktop suite would become:```DesktopTests for page-load performance.* Browsertime amazon* Browsertime bing-search* ...```Note how the descriptions are not inserted. We will be able to make use of the changes made in this bug: https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1637058Instead of returning a section with a header we would do the following (which builds a list):```return ["* " + title]``` § 2020-05-25T16:12:41Z § 2020-06-01T21:50:20Z

column1: 1633747 § FIXED § -- § defect § RESOLVED § Components § 7 § P1 § None§ 0§ 0§None§ 0§ 0§None§ 0§ 0§None§ 0§ 0§None§ 0§ 0§None§ 0§ 0§None§ 0§ 0§It's problematic to pass buffers containing `NaN` to the OS. Sheppy reports that it kills his system audio and he needed to reboot
column2: and in my case
column3: it kills the audio of the machine until the page that were outputing the audio is closed. We are both on OSX.Since it's fairly easy to make a mistake in an `AudioWorkletProcessor` and output `NaN`
column4: we need to do something about it.I have some vector code that change `NaN` to 0.0f running in about 30ns for a block of 128 frames  (compared to 250+ns with naive scalar code) on x86 (I haven't tested ARM yet)
column5: so the performance impact is too small to matter.I don't know if we want to do this per `AudioWorkletProcessor` instance
column6: and potentially log a message to the developer console. For now the patch is going to be in `GraphDriver.cpp`.§793§4 § It's problematic to pass buffers containing `NaN` to the OS. Sheppy reports that it kills his system audio and he needed to reboot
column7: and in my case
column8: it kills the audio of the machine until the page that were outputing the audio is closed. We are both on OSX.Since it's fairly easy to make a mistake in an `AudioWorkletProcessor` and output `NaN`
column9: we need to do something about it.I have some vector code that change `NaN` to 0.0f running in about 30ns for a block of 128 frames  (compared to 250+ns with naive scalar code) on x86 (I haven't tested ARM yet)
column10: so the performance impact is too small to matter.I don't know if we want to do this per `AudioWorkletProcessor` instance
column11: and potentially log a message to the developer console. For now the patch is going to be in `GraphDriver.cpp`. § 2020-04-28T14:17:54Z § 2020-05-04T15:54:38Z

column1: 1476664 § FIXED § normal § defect § RESOLVED § Client Software § 11 § P3 § Windows 10 64bit.macOS 10.13.4Ubuntu 16.04 64bit.§52§3§None§ 0§ 0§1. Launch Firefox.2. Go to about:preferences.3. Write "Organiza" in the "Find in options" search field.4. Go to "Saved Addresses".§134§4§The string entered in step 3 is displayed as highlighted above the "Add" button in the "Saved Addresses" panel.§112§1§The searched string is not displayed as highlighted above the "Add" button.[Regression range]:This seems to be a regression:Last good revision: e62d73ef396c32ca930897eb95d328e2ac15a901First bad revision: a831178ed112be4db3c867876b99e61d22bdbc7aPushlog:https://hg.mozilla.org/integration/autoland/pushloghtml?fromchange=e62d73ef396c32ca930897eb95d328e2ac15a901&tochange=a831178ed112be4db3c867876b99e61d22bdbc7a[Additional information]:For further information regarding this issue please observe the attached screencast.Please note that the searched string is displayed highlighted above the "Add" button only after accessing the "Add New Address" panel by clicking the "Add" button and going back to the "Saved Addresses" panel again via the "Cancel" button.§767§10§None§ 0§ 0§None§ 0§ 0§[Affected versions]:Firefox 63.0a1 (BuildId:20180718100918).Firefox 62.0b9 (BuildId:20180713213322).Firefox 61.0.1 (BuildId:20180704003137).[Unaffected versions]:Firefox 60.1.0 esr (BuildId:20180621121604).§212§6 § [Affected versions]:Firefox 63.0a1 (BuildId:20180718100918).Firefox 62.0b9 (BuildId:20180713213322).Firefox 61.0.1 (BuildId:20180704003137).[Unaffected versions]:Firefox 60.1.0 esr (BuildId:20180621121604).[Affected platforms]:Windows 10 64bit.macOS 10.13.4Ubuntu 16.04 64bit.[Steps to reproduce]:1. Launch Firefox.2. Go to about:preferences.3. Write "Organiza" in the "Find in options" search field.4. Go to "Saved Addresses".[Expected result]:The string entered in step 3 is displayed as highlighted above the "Add" button in the "Saved Addresses" panel.[Actual result]:The searched string is not displayed as highlighted above the "Add" button.[Regression range]:This seems to be a regression:Last good revision: e62d73ef396c32ca930897eb95d328e2ac15a901First bad revision: a831178ed112be4db3c867876b99e61d22bdbc7aPushlog:https://hg.mozilla.org/integration/autoland/pushloghtml?fromchange=e62d73ef396c32ca930897eb95d328e2ac15a901&tochange=a831178ed112be4db3c867876b99e61d22bdbc7a[Additional information]:For further information regarding this issue please observe the attached screencast.Please note that the searched string is displayed highlighted above the "Add" button only after accessing the "Add New Address" panel by clicking the "Add" button and going back to the "Saved Addresses" panel again via the "Cancel" button. § 2018-07-18T15:39:16Z § 2021-10-22T14:58:08Z

1636031 § WORKSFORME § -- § enhancement § RESOLVED § Client Software § 2 § P1 § None§ 0§ 0§None§ 0§ 0§None§ 0§ 0§None§ 0§ 0§None§ 0§ 0§None§ 0§ 0§None§ 0§ 0§Firefox Lite was attempting to [enable Glean](https://github.com/mozilla-tw/FirefoxLite/pull/4953) on their product.However
column2: adding the SDK on their end produced an increase of 2MB of the APK (which is generally ~6MB). The Firefox Lite APK size can't increase that much due to business requirements and that makes Glean not a viable option at this point.The Firefox Reality team evaluated [dynamic delivery](https://developer.android.com/guide/app-bundle/dynamic-delivery) but it's not an option
column3: since a big chunk of the installs happen outside of the play store. From that issue:> > > Even if we replace the legacy Telemetry library with Glean
column4: we'll still 2MB over our budget.> (8396272 > 6291456.0)> > I first think we can use Dynamic Feature.> But we have 10-20% of users that download our app outside of the Play Store. (concern 1)> > Proposal 2:> Using ABI-split might not help much cause the size is still around 1.2 to 1.9 MB.> I think the product team only accept at most 600 to 700K (around 10%) growth in APK size. (@shsu571 please help confirm) (concern 2)> > I can't think of a better way right now.We need to investigate ways of reducing the size of Glean.§1188§17 § Firefox Lite was attempting to [enable Glean](https://github.com/mozilla-tw/FirefoxLite/pull/4953) on their product.However
column5: adding the SDK on their end produced an increase of 2MB of the APK (which is generally ~6MB). The Firefox Lite APK size can't increase that much due to business requirements and that makes Glean not a viable option at this point.The Firefox Reality team evaluated [dynamic delivery](https://developer.android.com/guide/app-bundle/dynamic-delivery) but it's not an option
column6: since a big chunk of the installs happen outside of the play store. From that issue:> > > Even if we replace the legacy Telemetry library with Glean
column7: we'll still 2MB over our budget.> (8396272 > 6291456.0)> > I first think we can use Dynamic Feature.> But we have 10-20% of users that download our app outside of the Play Store. (concern 1)> > Proposal 2:> Using ABI-split might not help much cause the size is still around 1.2 to 1.9 MB.> I think the product team only accept at most 600 to 700K (around 10%) growth in APK size. (@shsu571 please help confirm) (concern 2)> > I can't think of a better way right now.We need to investigate ways of reducing the size of Glean. § 2020-05-07T06:21:24Z § 2020-05-07T14:16:18Z
