column1: 1640641 § FIXED § -- § enhancement § RESOLVED § Components § 11 § P1 § None§ 0§ 0§None§ 0§ 0§None§ 0§ 0§None§ 0§ 0§None§ 0§ 0§None§ 0§ 0§None§ 0§ 0§Bug 1620243 is about to emit RDP events with a list of resources.But the current implementation of ResourceWatcher is notifying about resources one by one. [ResourceWatcher._onResourceAvailable](https://searchfox.org/mozilla-central/rev/501eb4718d73870892d28f31a99b46f4783efaa0/devtools/shared/resources/resource-watcher.js#210) is receiving resources one by one.The goal here would only be about receiving a list of resources in `_onResourceAvailable`.The frontend may still keep receiving resources one by one. But at least ResourceWatcher should process them by chunk. We can always followup in order to make the Frontend also process resources by chunks.§662§4 § Bug 1620243 is about to emit RDP events with a list of resources.But the current implementation of ResourceWatcher is notifying about resources one by one. [ResourceWatcher._onResourceAvailable](https://searchfox.org/mozilla-central/rev/501eb4718d73870892d28f31a99b46f4783efaa0/devtools/shared/resources/resource-watcher.js#210) is receiving resources one by one.The goal here would only be about receiving a list of resources in `_onResourceAvailable`.The frontend may still keep receiving resources one by one. But at least ResourceWatcher should process them by chunk. We can always followup in order to make the Frontend also process resources by chunks. § 2020-05-25T13:43:31Z § 2020-05-29T10:06:27Z

1631258 § FIXED § -- § task § RESOLVED § Components § 10 § P1 § None§ 0§ 0§None§ 0§ 0§None§ 0§ 0§None§ 0§ 0§None§ 0§ 0§None§ 0§ 0§None§ 0§ 0§I'd like to reorganize and rename the headers a little bit for Stencil.- `StencilEnums.h`  - Rename the current `TryNoteKinds.h`  - This would contain just the enum values and their documentation.  - We split this out for use by parts deep inside the parsers that use their own data structures but want to have the same meanings.- `StencilShared.h`  - Rename the current `SharedStencil.h`  - This is data structures shared between the VM and Stencil. We should reduce the number of dependencies needed where possible. These structures are candidates for direct memory sharing between the VM and Stencil.- `Stencil.h`  - These are the structures for completing the Stencil representation
column2: but that cannot be directly used by the VM. This includes things like `ScriptStencil` that is analagous to the `BaseScript` of the VM but not directly compatible.In the future we can consider moving the first files to rust and using bindings generation.§952§11 § I'd like to reorganize and rename the headers a little bit for Stencil.- `StencilEnums.h`  - Rename the current `TryNoteKinds.h`  - This would contain just the enum values and their documentation.  - We split this out for use by parts deep inside the parsers that use their own data structures but want to have the same meanings.- `StencilShared.h`  - Rename the current `SharedStencil.h`  - This is data structures shared between the VM and Stencil. We should reduce the number of dependencies needed where possible. These structures are candidates for direct memory sharing between the VM and Stencil.- `Stencil.h`  - These are the structures for completing the Stencil representation
column3: but that cannot be directly used by the VM. This includes things like `ScriptStencil` that is analagous to the `BaseScript` of the VM but not directly compatible.In the future we can consider moving the first files to rust and using bindings generation. § 2020-04-19T14:30:05Z § 2020-04-20T10:00:30Z

column2: or Print > Print Preview from the Menu button.Click the "Print" button in the dialog window.The email doesn't print.The email should print.The [release notes](https://www.thunderbird.net/en-US/thunderbird/77.0beta/releasenotes/) indicate that "Print progress dialog is disabled" is an **Unresolved Issue**. It doesn't look disabled in the Config Editor.Toggling  "print.show_print_progress" to "false" fixes the issue and emails print.Calendar printing works with "print.show_print_progress" set to "true" or "false"§606§8 § Select an email in the Thread Pane.Select File > Print Preview from the Menu bar

It doesn't look disabled in the Config Editor.Toggling  "print.show_print_progress" to "false" fixes the issue and emails print.Calendar printing works with "print.show_print_progress" set to "true" or "false" § 2020-05-13T16:41:31Z § 2020-05-20T11:49:26Z

column1: 1456124 § INVALID § normal § defect § RESOLVED § Client Software § 3 § P1 § - All Windows- All Linux- All Mac§36§3§- Have a new Firefox profile.- Have the following prefs. in the "about:config" page (If a preference does not exist
column2: please create it):	- “xpinstall.signatures.required” pref set to “false”;	- “browser.search.countryCode” pref set to "US".- Have the latest "Google Code Correction" add-on (1.0) installed from https://goo.gl/P2KVst.§337§5§1. Open the browser with the profile from prerequisites and navigate to the "about:support" page.2. Select the "Restart with Add-ons Disabled..." option and click the "Restart" button.4. Click the "Start in Safe Mode: button and focus the "Search Bar".5. Write any word and press the "Enter" key.6. Observe the URL.§320§5§- The URL contains the "firefox-b-1" string.§45§1§- The URL does not contains the "firefox-b-1" string.[Notes]:- We are not sure how close this scenario is by the behavior of a system add-on. However disabling the add-on when the browser is not is the "Safe Mode" will keep generating the "firefox-b-1" string when searches are made.§286§3§- The issue is reproducible with the non-US builds.- Attached a screen recording of the issue.§96§2§None§ 0§ 0§[Affected Versions]:- Firefox 43- Firefox 45 ESR- Firefox 46- Firefox 52 ESR- Firefox 56§94§6 § [Affected Versions]:- Firefox 43- Firefox 45 ESR- Firefox 46- Firefox 52 ESR- Firefox 56[Affected Platforms]:- All Windows- All Linux- All Mac[Preconditions]:- Have a new Firefox profile.- Have the following prefs. in the "about:config" page (If a preference does not exist
column3: please create it):	- “xpinstall.signatures.required” pref set to “false”;	- “browser.search.countryCode” pref set to "US".- Have the latest "Google Code Correction" add-on (1.0) installed from https://goo.gl/P2KVst.[Steps to reproduce]:1. Open the browser with the profile from prerequisites and navigate to the "about:support" page.2. Select the "Restart with Add-ons Disabled..." option and click the "Restart" button.4. Click the "Start in Safe Mode: button and focus the "Search Bar".5. Write any word and press the "Enter" key.6. Observe the URL.[Expected result]:- The URL contains the "firefox-b-1" string.[Actual result]:- The URL does not contains the "firefox-b-1" string.[Notes]:- We are not sure how close this scenario is by the behavior of a system add-on. However disabling the add-on when the browser is not is the "Safe Mode" will keep generating the "firefox-b-1" string when searches are made.- The issue is reproducible with the non-US builds.- Attached a screen recording of the issue. § 2018-04-23T13:56:20Z § 2018-05-01T19:12:51Z

column5: the tab is not usable after.This is an existing problem but it is easier to happen after 1603384. The cubeb device change behavior has modified in Linux and a device unplug event is followed by a cubeb state change to error. I HATE IE!}§216§2§: Always§9§1§:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.8.0.6) Gecko/20060728 Firefox/1.5.0.6Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.8.0.6) Gecko/20060728 Firefox/1.5.0.6Whenever I attemtp to print anything with Firefox I cannot get my printer to work. It works for all my other applications and for Internet Explorer. I was trying to print shipping lablels from Paypal when the problem began yesterday. I have since uninstalled my printer and reinstalled it and all associated software but the problem persists. I have tested the printer twice and it is functional. After running several test prints I have found Firefox to be the problem. I an unassociated note I also have a problem with stereaming video and playing from a media player like Creative or Windows Media Player 11. I cannot acess any printer controls and the two problems seem interconnected. When I attempt to print I get the "Save file to folder" screen and it is followed by the message "printer failed to print". I also get the message "file could not be sent to printer." This problemn continues after uninsrtalling Firefox and reinstalling it. I suspect an upgrade to this program may be at fault but because this problem appeared in the middle of a print job yesterday my suspicions are dubious. Everything else works fine and it is Firefox that is the problem. The question is how do I fix this?§1409§3§§0§0 § User Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.8.0.6) Gecko/20060728 Firefox/1.5.0.6Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.8.0.6) Gecko/20060728 Firefox/1.5.0.6Whenever I attemtp to print anything with Firefox I cannot get my printer to work. column1: 1582740 § FIXED § normal § defect § RESOLVED § Client Software § 17 § P1 § * Windows 10 64bit.* Windows 7 64bit.* macOS 10.13.* Ubuntu 16.04 64bit.§76§4§None§ 0§ 0§1. Launch Firefox.2. Access the about:preferences page.3. Click the "Make Default" button. (in order to lock the "Always check if Firefox is your  default browser checkbox).4. Refresh the about:preferences page.5. Quickly uncheck the "Always check if Firefox is your default browser" checkbox.§298§5§* Unchecking the "Always check if Firefox is your default browser" checkbox is not possible as long as it is locked.* The browser.shell.checkDefaultBrowser pref remains set to true and refreshing the about:preferences page doesn't save the actions performed in step 5.§270§2§* The user is able to check the "Always check if Firefox is your default browser" checkbox if the about:preferences page is refreshed even though it is displayed as locked.* The browser.shell.CheckDefaultBrowser pref changes to false and the actions performed in step 5 are saved.#### Regression rangeLast good revision: e4b9b1084292686d3eb50ba0cadd85950824c955 (2019-01-25)First bad revision: bb2895bfd1bc3d83c309e904dbe74e0c60c3fac9 (2019-01-26)Pushlog:https://hg.mozilla.org/mozilla-central/pushloghtml?fromchange=e4b9b1084292686d3eb50ba0cadd85950824c955&tochange=bb2895bfd1bc3d83c309e904dbe74e0c60c3fac9#### Additional notes* For further information regarding this issue
column2: please observe the attached screencast.* Note: Bug 1532701 was not fixed
column3: so we created another one.§786§10§None§ 0§ 0§None§ 0§ 0§#### Affected versions* Firefox 68.1.0esr* Firefox 69.0.8* Firefox 70.b8* Firefox 71.0a1 §94§5 § #### Affected versions* Firefox 68.1.0esr* Firefox 69.0.8* Firefox 70.b8* Firefox 71.0a1 #### Affected platforms* Windows 10 64bit.* Windows 7 64bit.* macOS 10.13.* Ubuntu 16.04 64bit.#### Steps to reproduce1. Launch Firefox.2. Access the about:preferences page.3. Click the "Make Default" button. (in order to lock the "Always check if Firefox is your  default browser checkbox).4. Refresh the about:preferences page.5. Quickly uncheck the "Always check if Firefox is your default browser" checkbox.#### Expected result* Unchecking the "Always check if Firefox is your default browser" checkbox is not possible as long as it is locked.* The browser.shell.checkDefaultBrowser pref remains set to true and refreshing the about:preferences page doesn't save the actions performed in step 5.#### Actual result* The user is able to check the "Always check if Firefox is your default browser" checkbox if the about:preferences page is refreshed even though it is displayed as locked.* The browser.shell.CheckDefaultBrowser pref changes to false and the actions performed in step 5 are saved.#### Regression rangeLast good revision: e4b9b1084292686d3eb50ba0cadd85950824c955 (2019-01-25)First bad revision: bb2895bfd1bc3d83c309e904dbe74e0c60c3fac9 (2019-01-26)Pushlog:https://hg.mozilla.org/mozilla-central/pushloghtml?fromchange=e4b9b1084292686d3eb50ba0cadd85950824c955&tochange=bb2895bfd1bc3d83c309e904dbe74e0c60c3fac9#### Additional notes* For further information regarding this issue
column4: please observe the attached screencast.* Note: Bug 1532701 was not fixed

Use task label instead of building it ourselves to ensure that the smilarity metrics use the correct page load variant and make the queries more robust.§438§4 § This bug is for making some improvements to the similarity metric:1. column3: one that is calculated against it's last task (same label) and another that is calculated against the live site variant if it exists.    1. Live site tests only have one calculated.2. column1: 1578385 § WONTFIX § normal § defect § RESOLVED § Client Software § 2 § P1 § - All Windows- All Linux§26§2§- Have a new Firefox profile with the `browser.newtabpage.activity-stream.asrouter.devtoolsEnabled` pref's value set to `true`.- Have 10 websites previously bookmarked.§170§2§1. Open the browser with the profile from the prerequisites.2. Navigate to a website which was not previously bookmarked.3. Click the "Bookmark this page" button from the right part of the "Address Bar".4. Restart the browser.5. Click the “Edit this bookmark” button from the right part of the “Address bar”6. Using the keyboard focus the “Dismiss” button.7. Observe the “Dismiss” button§394§7§- The “Dismiss” button has a focus effect. §44§1§- The “Dismiss” button does not have a focus effect.**[Notes]:**§66§2§- This issue is reproducible with both the dark and light theme enabled.- Attached a screen recording of the issue.§117§2§None§ 0§ 0§**[Affected versions]:**- Firefox Nightly 71.0a1
column2: Build ID: 20190902213933- Firefox Beta 70.0b3
column3: Build ID: 20190902191027§124§3 § **[Affected versions]:**- Firefox Nightly 71.0a1
column4: Build ID: 20190902213933- Firefox Beta 70.0b3
column5: Build ID: 20190902191027**[Affected Platforms]:**- All Windows- All Linux**[Preconditions]:**- Have a new Firefox profile with the `browser.newtabpage.activity-stream.asrouter.devtoolsEnabled` pref's value set to `true`.- Have 10 websites previously bookmarked.**[Steps to reproduce]:**1. Open the browser with the profile from the prerequisites.2. Navigate to a website which was not previously bookmarked.3. Click the "Bookmark this page" button from the right part of the "Address Bar".4. Restart the browser.5. Click the “Edit this bookmark” button from the right part of the “Address bar”6. Using the keyboard focus the “Dismiss” button.7. Observe the “Dismiss” button**[Expected result]:**- The “Dismiss” button has a focus effect. **[Actual result]:**- The “Dismiss” button does not have a focus effect.**[Notes]:**- This issue is not reproducible on Mac OS.- This issue is reproducible with both the dark and light theme enabled.- Attached a screen recording of the issue. § 2019-09-03T12:47:26Z § 2021-03-10T11:09:06Z

column1: 1634468 § FIXED § -- § enhancement § RESOLVED § Client Software § 19 § P1 § ### Is this about changing an existing metric type or creating a new one?Creating a new metric type### Can you describe the data that needs to be recorded?For Account Ecosystem Telemetry
column2: we need clients to be able to send "account ecosystem" pings with various metrics. The defining feature of an account ecosystem ping is that it includes a sensitive `ecosystem_anon_id` value that must be decrypted by the data pipeline and replaced with the decrypted `ecosystem_user_id` value before the ping is uploaded to BigQuery.### Can you provide a raw sample of the data that needs to be recorded (this is in the abstract
column3: and not any particular implementation details about its representation in the payload or the database)The client receives or generates an ecosystem_anon_id value during the FxA login flow. [The ecosystem_anon_id value is a JOSE JWE object in compact serialization form](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1zH3eVVI_28Afg1JXe_McDrW4MTYuWhiJMQR6AQbli8I/edit#)
column4: consisting of several hundred characters. That value includes the value to be decrypted along with various metadata describing the public key used to encrypt
column5: encryption type
column6: etc. An example value with whitespace added:```eyJhbGciOiJFQ0RILUVTIiwia2lkIjoiMFZFRTdmT0txbFdHVGZrY0taRUJ2WWl3dkpMYTRUUGlJVGxXMGJOcDdqVSIsImVwayI6eyJrdHkiOiJFQyIsImNydiI6IlAtMjU2IiwieCI6InY3Q1FlRWtVQjMwUGwxV0tPMUZUZ25OQlNQdlFyNlh0UnZxT2kzSWdzNHciLCJ5IjoiNDBKVEpaQlMwOXpWNHpxb0hHZDI5NGFDeHRqcGU5a09reGhELVctUEZsSSJ9LCJlbmMiOiJBMjU2R0NNIn0..A_wzJya943vlHKFH.yq0JhkGZiZd6UiZK6goTcEf6i4gbbBeXxvq8QV5_nC4.Knl_sYSBrrP-aa54z6B6gA```### What is the business question/use-case that requires the data to be recorded?The overall business case for Account Ecosystem Telemetry is nuanced. See the [Product Ecosystem Metrics Proposal](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1KCMN-3UduDy9a2OuUK5msIYcTv9rZsCRtZyPvKaaIGk/edit#heading=h.e4sche1qjtao).### How would the data be consumed?The `ecosystem_user_id` values present in BigQuery would allow us to correlate usage of a single FxA user across multiple products without knowing who that user is. Various aggregations would be performed across products
column7: grouping by the shared `ecosystem_anon_id` values.### Why existing metric types are not enough?There are several details here that bump up against limitations of the current Glean SDK.First
column8: `ecosystem_anon_id` values are larger than the current limits of 100 characters for a string metrics or 50 characters for a string list metric.Second
column9: this value is subject to a new preprocessing step that has not previously existed in the pipeline. The client would be sending a metric with one name
column10: and the pipeline would remove that field
column11: decrypt it
column12: and place a new `ecosystem_user_id` field into the ping before sending it to the normal Decoder step where schema validation
column13: etc. is performed.### What is the timeline by which the data needs to be collected?We are targeting desktop first for Account Ecosystem Telemetry

We then started Firefox using a new profile.Upon startup

column1: 1642868 § FIXED § -- § defect § RESOLVED § Other § 17 § P1 § Examples:Update verify config generator task: https://firefox-ci-tc.services.mozilla.com/tasks/LdcZR5OvQV6lQD8dO2O4KwFailed test: https://firefox-ci-tc.services.mozilla.com/tasks/AlLFFcx0RauBiWJpZxGabgWe have some options:1) backout bug 1635103. Not ideal. It would be great to stop using shipped-locales in the tests all together.2) hardcode the ja-JP-mac exception in the config generator3) stop using shipped-locales and use https://searchfox.org/mozilla-central/source/browser/locales/l10n-changesets.json4) We can implement 2) and then 3) so we move faster§569§8§None§ 0§ 0§None§ 0§ 0§None§ 0§ 0§None§ 0§ 0§None§ 0§ 0§None§ 0§ 0§§0§0 § After bug 1635103 is landed

column1: 1643564 § FIXED § -- § task § RESOLVED § Client Software § 6 § P1 § - it only packs one dll in the final nuget package
column2: which means we'd need a package for each target architecture.We should fix that.§134§2§None§ 0§ 0§None§ 0§ 0§None§ 0§ 0§None§ 0§ 0§None§ 0§ 0§None§ 0§ 0§The current [C# project](https://github.com/mozilla/glean/blob/cc28d5106f90f1eed20334b8e38c6e619f569776/glean-core/csharp/csharp/Glean.csproj#L16) picks the "glean_ffi.dll" debug library and packs it in the nuget package for its consumers.This approach does not work for multiple reasons:§290§2 § The current [C# project](https://github.com/mozilla/glean/blob/cc28d5106f90f1eed20334b8e38c6e619f569776/glean-core/csharp/csharp/Glean.csproj#L16) picks the "glean_ffi.dll" debug library and packs it in the nuget package for its consumers.This approach does not work for multiple reasons:- the artefact to use depends on the platform (e.g. .so libraries on linux)- it only packs one dll in the final nuget package
column3: which means we'd need a package for each target architecture.We should fix that. § 2020-06-05T05:48:19Z § 2020-06-08T13:41:17Z

column1: 1639374 § FIXED § -- § task § RESOLVED § Components § 4 § P1 § §0§0§None§ 0§ 0§None§ 0§ 0§None§ 0§ 0§None§ 0§ 0§None§ 0§ 0§None§ 0§ 0§This bug is for disabling most of the browsertime tests running on mozilla-central and autoland. They are only there as "smoke-tests" and the data isn't (and shouldn't be) ingested anywhere.Here's autoland: https://treeherder.mozilla.org/#/jobs?repo=autoland&tier=1%2C2%2C3&searchStr=browsertime&revision=ff07fdc7c70e1c0a45e10535e26e5dec7958a7a0Here's mozilla-central: https://treeherder.mozilla.org/#/jobs?repo=mozilla-central&tier=1%2C2%2C3&searchStr=browsertime§467§3 § This bug is for disabling most of the browsertime tests running on mozilla-central and autoland. They are only there as "smoke-tests" and the data isn't (and shouldn't be) ingested anywhere.Here's autoland: https://treeherder.mozilla.org/#/jobs?repo=autoland&tier=1%2C2%2C3&searchStr=browsertime&revision=ff07fdc7c70e1c0a45e10535e26e5dec7958a7a0Here's mozilla-central: https://treeherder.mozilla.org/#/jobs?repo=mozilla-central&tier=1%2C2%2C3&searchStr=browsertimeI'm thinking that we should disable all the autoland tests since they aren't being used for anything and run the benchmarks on mozilla-central if we want to. That said
column2: on mozilla-central
column3: I think we should restrict all the tests to linux64-shippable and disable all other platforms (on desktop). § 2020-05-19T22:32:51Z § 2020-06-26T17:57:06Z

column1: 1644743 § FIXED § -- § enhancement § RESOLVED § Client Software § 9 § P1 § None§ 0§ 0§None§ 0§ 0§None§ 0§ 0§None§ 0§ 0§None§ 0§ 0§None§ 0§ 0§None§ 0§ 0§[Tech Doc](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1On5waXqNN6vzQnVICwLTlVYjUqXv8ZDhkgWp2XLt678/edit?skip_itp2_check=true&pli=1#heading=h.31gjgjgnwbs0).Right now there are several targeting environments in use:* [ClientEnvironment](https://searchfox.org/mozilla-central/source/toolkit/components/utils/ClientEnvironment.jsm) used by RemoteSettingsClient.jsm* A different (normandy) [ClientEnvironment](https://searchfox.org/mozilla-central/source/toolkit/components/normandy/lib/ClientEnvironment.jsm) used by Normandy** [ASRouterTargeting](https://searchfox.org/mozilla-central/source/browser/components/newtab/lib/ASRouterTargeting.jsm) used by the Messaging SystemWe need a new targeting environment (and maintain backwards compatibility) in order to add new (required) features around telemetry and logging for population estimation. This will replace Normandy but also be used by Exp Manager and other modules that need it.§929§6 § [Tech Doc](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1On5waXqNN6vzQnVICwLTlVYjUqXv8ZDhkgWp2XLt678/edit?skip_itp2_check=true&pli=1#heading=h.31gjgjgnwbs0).Right now there are several targeting environments in use:* [ClientEnvironment](https://searchfox.org/mozilla-central/source/toolkit/components/utils/ClientEnvironment.jsm) used by RemoteSettingsClient.jsm* A different (normandy) [ClientEnvironment](https://searchfox.org/mozilla-central/source/toolkit/components/normandy/lib/ClientEnvironment.jsm) used by Normandy** [ASRouterTargeting](https://searchfox.org/mozilla-central/source/browser/components/newtab/lib/ASRouterTargeting.jsm) used by the Messaging SystemWe need a new targeting environment (and maintain backwards compatibility) in order to add new (required) features around telemetry and logging for population estimation. This will replace Normandy but also be used by Exp Manager and other modules that need it. § 2020-06-10T14:08:19Z § 2020-08-18T21:45:30Z

column1: 1631434 § FIXED § -- § task § RESOLVED § Components § 4 § P1 § None§ 0§ 0§None§ 0§ 0§None§ 0§ 0§None§ 0§ 0§None§ 0§ 0§None§ 0§ 0§None§ 0§ 0§Based on [:asuth comment in Bug 1630413 comment 3](https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1630413#c3)
column2: there is a chance that as part of [Bug 1558478](https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1558478) a future Firefox version may opt to clear all the stored data when `unlimitedStorage` is removed (as a side effect of losing the "persistent storage" site permission) and so it seems reasonable to explicit assert in the existing [test_unlimitedStorage_removed_on_update](https://searchfox.org/mozilla-central/rev/a4d62e09a4c46aef918667fa759bf9ae898dc258/toolkit/components/extensions/test/xpcshell/test_ext_unlimitedStorage.js#88) test case that after `unlimitedStorage` permission has been removed the existing extension data is still available (so that we make sure that we will notice if we decide to change the current behavior
column3: and we can take appropriate action to prevent the change of behavior to generate an unexpected "data loss" scenario for the extensions).§981§1 § Based on [:asuth comment in Bug 1630413 comment 3](https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1630413#c3)
column4: there is a chance that as part of [Bug 1558478](https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1558478) a future Firefox version may opt to clear all the stored data when `unlimitedStorage` is removed (as a side effect of losing the "persistent storage" site permission) and so it seems reasonable to explicit assert in the existing [test_unlimitedStorage_removed_on_update](https://searchfox.org/mozilla-central/rev/a4d62e09a4c46aef918667fa759bf9ae898dc258/toolkit/components/extensions/test/xpcshell/test_ext_unlimitedStorage.js#88) test case that after `unlimitedStorage` permission has been removed the existing extension data is still available (so that we make sure that we will notice if we decide to change the current behavior
column5: and we can take appropriate action to prevent the change of behavior to generate an unexpected "data loss" scenario for the extensions). § 2020-04-20T14:01:51Z § 2020-04-28T03:57:28Z

column1: 1634133 § INVALID § -- § task § RESOLVED § Components § 1 § P1 § None§ 0§ 0§None§ 0§ 0§None§ 0§ 0§None§ 0§ 0§None§ 0§ 0§None§ 0§ 0§None§ 0§ 0§The update agent needs an implementation of what I think of as the update state machine
column2: which begins with running an update check and evaluating its result to determine what patch and download URL to begin using
column3: and then continues shepherding that update through the rest of the process
column4: including implementing a lot of our fallbacks and error handling. The current implementation of this logic in the Firefox update manager is somewhat scattered and ad hoc
column5: and I'd like for this version to be more centralized and formal to the extent possible
column6: in the hope of making it easier to understand and less daunting. I'm not planning any major changes to the existing logic itself
column7: just how it's organized
column8: except for changes that are mandated by the nature of the background agent and how it is executed. There will need to be some pretty serious test coverage to protect against regressions.That said
column9: I do also intend to take the opportunity to at least investigate a couple of enhancements to this logic
column10: namely bug 353804
column11: adding the ability to obsolete and not continue applying updates that are in progress when a newer one is found
column12: and bug 1468549
column13: using HTTPS for update checks (relevant here because it may require the ability to fall back to unencrypted HTTP if there are too many problems).§1303§3 § The update agent needs an implementation of what I think of as the update state machine
column14: which begins with running an update check and evaluating its result to determine what patch and download URL to begin using
column15: and then continues shepherding that update through the rest of the process
column16: including implementing a lot of our fallbacks and error handling. The current implementation of this logic in the Firefox update manager is somewhat scattered and ad hoc
column17: and I'd like for this version to be more centralized and formal to the extent possible
column18: in the hope of making it easier to understand and less daunting. I'm not planning any major changes to the existing logic itself
column20: except for changes that are mandated by the nature of the background agent and how it is executed. There will need to be some pretty serious test coverage to protect against regressions.That said

column1: 1532701 § FIXED § normal § defect § RESOLVED § Client Software § 24 § P3 § * Windows 10 64bit.* Windows 7 64bit.* macOS 10.13.* Ubuntu 16.04 64bit.§76§4§None§ 0§ 0§1. Launch Firefox.2. Access the about:preferences page.3. Click the "Make Default" button. (in order to lock the "Always check if Firefox is your default browser checkbox).4. Refresh the about:preferences page.5. Quickly uncheck the "Always check if Firefox is your default browser" checkbox.§297§5§* Unchecking the "Always check if Firefox is your default browser" checkbox is not possible as long as it is locked.* The browser.shell.checkDefaultBrowser pref remains set to true and refreshing the about:preferences page doesn't save the actions performed in step 5.§270§2§* The user is able to check the "Always check if Firefox is your default browser" checkbox if the about:preferences page is refreshed even though it is displayed as locked. * The browser.shell.CheckDefaultBrowser pref changes to false and the actions performed in step 5 are saved.**Regression range**I will try to get back with a regression range asap.**Additional notes*** For further information regarding this issue
column2: please observe the attached screencast.§466§6§None§ 0§ 0§None§ 0§ 0§**Affected versions*** Firefox 66.0b13 (BuildId:20190304101322).* Firefox 67.0a1 (BuildID:20190305092747).* Firefox 65.0.2 (BuildId:20190225143501).* Firefox 60.5.2esr (BuildId:20190221164337).§198§5 § **Affected versions*** Firefox 66.0b13 (BuildId:20190304101322).* Firefox 67.0a1 (BuildID:20190305092747).* Firefox 65.0.2 (BuildId:20190225143501).* Firefox 60.5.2esr (BuildId:20190221164337).**Affected platforms*** Windows 10 64bit.* Windows 7 64bit.* macOS 10.13.* Ubuntu 16.04 64bit.**Steps to reproduce**1. Launch Firefox.2. Access the about:preferences page.3. Click the "Make Default" button. (in order to lock the "Always check if Firefox is your default browser checkbox).4. Refresh the about:preferences page.5. Quickly uncheck the "Always check if Firefox is your default browser" checkbox.**Expected result*** Unchecking the "Always check if Firefox is your default browser" checkbox is not possible as long as it is locked.* The browser.shell.checkDefaultBrowser pref remains set to true and refreshing the about:preferences page doesn't save the actions performed in step 5.**Actual result*** The user is able to check the "Always check if Firefox is your default browser" checkbox if the about:preferences page is refreshed even though it is displayed as locked. * The browser.shell.CheckDefaultBrowser pref changes to false and the actions performed in step 5 are saved.**Regression range**I will try to get back with a regression range asap.**Additional notes*** For further information regarding this issue
column3: please observe the attached screencast. § 2019-03-05T16:39:43Z § 2020-11-10T17:00:12Z

column1: 1515273 § WONTFIX § normal § defect § RESOLVED § Client Software § 2 § P3 § - All Windows- All Linux- All Mac§36§3§- Have the latest Firefox Nightly build installed.- Have the "Browser Console" opened.- Have a Firefox profile with the following pref in the "about:config" page:	- "browser.newtabpage.activity-stream.asrouterExperimentEnabled" with "true" value;	§252§5§1. Open the browser with the profile from prerequisites.2. Navigate to "about:config#asrouter" page.3. Scroll down to the "SNIPPETS_SEND_TO_DEVICE_TEST" section and click the "Show" button.4. Click the "Install now" button.5. Observe the Firefox icon.§256§5§- The Firefox icon is correctly displayed.§43§1§- The Firefox icon is blurry.[Additional Notes]:§50§2§- This issue is also reproducible with the "Send to Device Email Only"
column2: "Send to Device Email Only" and "EOY_BOLD_TEST_1" snippets.- The issue is more visible for the "Send to Device" snippets.- Here is a screenshot with "Bold EOY" snippet: https://goo.gl/e924wR- Here is a screenshot with "Standard EOY" snippet: https://goo.gl/HYcUQR- Attached a screenshots with the "SNIPPETS_SEND_TO_DEVICE_TEST" snippet.§413§5§None§ 0§ 0§[Affected versions]:- Firefox 64.0 and above§46§2 § [Affected versions]:- Firefox 64.0 and above[Affected Platforms]:- All Windows- All Linux- All Mac[Preconditions]:- Have the latest Firefox Nightly build installed.- Have the "Browser Console" opened.- Have a Firefox profile with the following pref in the "about:config" page:	- "browser.newtabpage.activity-stream.asrouterExperimentEnabled" with "true" value;	[Steps to reproduce]:1. Open the browser with the profile from prerequisites.2. Navigate to "about:config#asrouter" page.3. Scroll down to the "SNIPPETS_SEND_TO_DEVICE_TEST" section and click the "Show" button.4. Click the "Install now" button.5. Observe the Firefox icon.[Expected result]:- The Firefox icon is correctly displayed.[Actual result]:- The Firefox icon is blurry.[Additional Notes]:- This issue is also reproducible with the "Send to Device Email Only"
